JOB SUMMARY:

The Risk/Accreditation & Regulatory Manager will design, implement, monitor and continually improve the enterprise-wide Risk Management and Accreditation & Regulatory Programs.

The enterprise-wide Risk Management Program provides a structured process for the flow of information and investigation of issues, minimizes real or potential risks and/or liabilities, provides loss control measures, and promotes risk reduction strategies by educating the MarinHealth Staff and Medical Staff. Elements of the Risk Management Program are designed and implemented to meet the standards of practice, protect the enterprise’s insurance program, and provide claim information to the insurer, with a focus on loss prevention. The program strives to continuously improve work processes specific to risk management and prevention. This will include the periodic review and analysis of data from Safety Incident Reports (SIRs), early warning systems, identification of high risk events/near misses and sentinel event management, MarinHealth Staff and Medical Staff education, performance improvement team participation, etc. The Manager will work closely and cooperatively with the Quality, Patient Safety, Medical Staff, and Patient Experience teams.

The Manager will coordinate the development and management of data systems that support ongoing regulatory compliance. The Manager will perform analytical and project management that supports the function of the Accreditation and Regulatory Program. The Manager will coordinate and manage the assessment, measurement, and reporting of ongoing compliance with accreditation standards and other state and federal regulatory requirements and oversee all accreditation and certification programs across the enterprise.

JOB SPECIFICATIONS:

EDUCATION

Bachelor's degree required.
Medical-legal working knowledge required.
A Master’s degree in related field preferred.
A law degree is highly desirable.

EXPERIENCE

Three to five years of direct experience in risk management and accreditation and regulatory management required.

PREREQUISITE SKILLS

Clinical knowledge and expertise to effectively develop, coordinate, and monitor programs related to risk management and accreditation and regulatory compliance
Demonstrated ability to develop excellent working relationships with MarinHealth Staff and Medical Staff to elicit cooperation for excellent program outcomes
Ability to work in diverse teams, and collaborate with a variety of groups and individual people
Ability to use appropriate problem solving techniques to achieve desired results and drive change for improvement
Ability to collaborate with Department leadership to design action plans for follow up regarding identified variations in care
Expertise in data collection, analysis, and presentation
Ability to manage change processes
Capable of prioritizing multiple tasks, using excellent time management skills and exhibiting attention to detail
Intermediate computer knowledge
Demonstrated verbal and written communication skills
Ability to read, write, speak, and understand the English language
Knowledge of regulations (Accreditation, State and Federal)
Knowledge of audit/study methodology and health statistics
Ability to perform job functions in a professional manner that respects the level of confidentiality necessary to be seen as reliable and trustworthy

LICENSE/REGISTRATION/CERTIFICATION:

Certification in Risk Management or Accreditation highly desirable

PRIMARY CUSTOMER SERVED (Age Specific Criteria):

This position is not a patient care position, and as such, this section does not apply.

PATIENT PRIVACY (HIPAA Compliance):

Employees in this position have access to protected health information. The protected health information a person in this position can access includes demographics, date of service, insurance/billing, medical record summary information, and all other information that may be contained in patient records. This position requires patient health information to perform the functions outlined as part of this position description.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Proactive Risk Assessment
a. Facilitate or support proactive risk assessment (e.g. failure mode and effects analysis)

b. Consult in the development of new services or clinical areas
Risk Surveillance
a. Identify trends and patterns related to patient and visitor safety from various sources (e.g. committee service; coding data; patient experience feedback)

b. Visit and critically assess environments of care and work processes in situ
Risk Management Consulting
a. Inform the development of policies with the risk management perspective through participation on the Policy and Procedure Committee

b. Inform committee decision-making with the risk management perspective by participation on committees where the activities promote engagement in all of the enterprise risk domains (e.g. strategic planning, technology, clinical and operational domains)

c. Advise on the application of Just Culture principles to specific situations

d. Provide consultation with suggested recommendations for problem resolution
Claims Management
a. Recognize potentially compensable events

b. Report potentially compensable events to insurer

c. Communicate with claimant on behalf of organization

d. Appropriately receive subpoenas on behalf of organization

e. Collect, document and communicate to designated attorneys requested information per established policies

f. Manage and maintain legal correspondence
Serious Adverse Event Management
a. Recognize and report events that must be reported to State and Federal and other authorities

b. Support disclosure of adverse events and ongoing communication with those affected by the event, including patients and families and providers and MarinHealth staff

c. Collaborate with Patient Safety to ensure patient safety events are addressed through the Patient Safety Program, as appropriate

d. Conduct a timely and thorough investigation and document findings

e. Facilitate or participate in a timely and credible event analysis (e.g. root cause analysis)

f. Facilitate or participate in the development of meaningful corrective action plans

g. Track progress and completion of action plans

h. Activate peer support for traumatized clinicians

i. Facilitate early resolution of claims
Accreditation & Regulatory
a. Develops appropriate data collection and assessment tools to support accreditation and regulatory activities in response to dynamic regulatory requirements.

b. Oversees and leads the Continuous Readiness team

i. Develops and timely submits the Periodic Performance Review

ii. Supports Chapter leads in implementation of new and revised accreditation standards and State and Federal laws

c. Serves as a resource for accreditation standards and State and Federal laws

d. Coordinates ongoing tracer activities in collaboration with other departments using a standardized set of tools and methodologies

e. Provides timely feedback about findings and staff performance to the appropriate manager or designee of the areas in which tracers are conducted

f. Synthesizes data and other information into summary format in a logical and systematic manner to facilitate conclusions and recommendations

g. Enters and verifies data collected into databases and web-based applications

h. Analyzes and reports findings and utilizes tracer tool and process to identify and report system issues and evaluate effectiveness of corrective actions and improvement strategies

i. Manages and distributes an Accreditation and Regulatory scorecard across the enterprise

j. Directly supports the Continuous Readiness Committee in preparation, organization, and maintenance of documents related to project management, meeting agendas and materials, action plans, and reports

k. Participates in the design and development of accreditation and other regulatory driven educational curricula, materials, tools and instructional methodologies

l. Interfaces with executives to track progress on

m. Strives for continuous professional development in maintaining and increasing knowledge and skills related to accreditation and regulatory requirements
Other
a. Develop goals and objectives and establish and implement policies and procedures for the enterprise-wide Risk Management/Accreditation & Regulatory Programs

Agency Summary

The Unity Council is a non-profit Social Equity Development Corporation with a 50-year history in the Fruitvale neighborhood of Oakland. Our mission is to promote social equity and improve quality of life by building vibrant communities where everyone can work, learn, and thrive.

Our programs aim to provide the community with the tools, knowledge, and resources to transform their lives and ultimately achieve their long-term educational, career, and financial goals. These holistic programs and services reach more than 8,000 individuals and families annually in five languages. Programs include: early childhood education, youth mentorship and leadership development, employment services, career readiness training, housing and financial stability, senior citizen services, affordable housing and neighborhood development, and arts and cultural events. Our work expands beyond the Fruitvale district and now reaches across Oakland and into Concord. The Unity Council employs a diverse workforce of more than 250 people who reflect the linguistic, cultural, and ethnic identity of the communities we serve.

Program Summary

The Children and Family Services programs include Head Start, Early Head Start, State Pre-Kindergarten, Home Based Services, and Developmental Play Groups. Over 900 children, birth through kindergarten entry and 32 expectant parents and their families receive child development and comprehensive family services through the Unity Council. The programs are diverse, multilingual, developmentally appropriate, culturally responsive, and individualized for each child, family services are provided in four centers, and two home based programs throughout Oakland and Monument Corridor neighborhood in Concord, CA.

Position Summary

Under the direction of the Sr. Compliance and Data Systems Manager, conduct a variety of analytical activities; analyze data, information, proposed legislation, policies and procedures for assigned program; and, prepare and present reports.

Responsibilities
Under the supervision of the Compliance Manager, coordinates the collection and preparation of data and information required by federal and state compliance agencies, dictated by program needs and necessary for leadership knowledge and decision-making.
Conduct and analyze the results of data and information,
Prepare reports and formulate recommendations as appropriate;
Review and process data and information requests;
Assist in preparing written responses regarding state and federal regulations affecting assigned programs;
Respond to inquiries regarding program data requirements, interpret program regulations, policies and procedures;
Provide research/evaluation support to each of CFS’s departments/programs
Conduct interviews/needs assessments with programs/departments and provide evaluation/research technical assistance and thought partnership
Design data collection instruments, administer surveys (online, paper, intercept, etc.), and conduct qualitative data collection and analysis
Develops presentations, briefs, reports, policy/advocacy fact sheets, and other evaluation products that include data visualization
Data Management
Work with all programs and staff to ensure quality data collection, reporting, quality control and assist in the management of the database system.
Collect client and participant data through surveys, focus groups, and other methods. Assist in survey design and analysis.
Train direct service staff to use data system and follow CFS’s data collection procedures.
Work closely with the Senior Manager to ensure all levels of staff are trained and are collecting and entering data into shared database.
Maintain overall data entry guidelines for Child Plus, Learning Genie, NOHO, Head Start, CACFP, CDMIS, CNIPS, and other databases;
Supports and coordinates the cyclical data entries in preparation of coordinated analysis with CCR Analytics;
Monitor data entry for quality assurance
Ensure data aligns with blue file documentation and other record formats
Perform a variety of special projects involving analysis of research, surveys, and other data; analyze and evaluate data and information; and prepare recommendations as appropriate;
Assist service area managers in data entry and monitoring;
Create and transfer existing paper forms into fillable forms, PDF’s, etc.
Support Sr. Manager with ongoing monitoring and self-assessment
Support quality assurance and control procedures: examine data for errors related to formatting; eliminate duplicate entries
Verify information and update ChildPlus to reflect recent changes, ensuring that the new data is correctly entered in the system
Assist with maintaining a calendar of program evaluation activities
Train staff on Child Plus and other databases as needed;
Other duties as assigned by management
Qualifications
AA or BA degree or higher degree in Sociology, Psychology, Business Administration or related field; or training in social services with at least 4 years of college level coursework;
Three or more years of experience working social services organizations
Knowledge of family and community services partnerships
Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.
Possession of a valid California drivers' license; current personal vehicle insurance, or safe driving record sufficient to ensure insurability through Agency policy;
The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus. Physical ability to sit with children on their level, lift infants, toddlers, and occasionally preschoolers. Commitment to utilize safe lifting techniques for lifting children, supplies and furnishings;
Bilingual Spanish preferred
Pre-Employment Requirements

Physical exam, TB test, background/fingerprint clearance, measles, pertussis immunizations.

Central CA Field Operations Manager

AG Gas – Petaluma, CA

SUMMARY

AG Gas is an emerging company with an innovative technology that provides CO2 enrichment services to stimulate the photosynthetic process and improve crop yields. Our trademarked Carbogation® service also greatly enhances crops’ water-use-efficiency and plant dynamics.

The target customers for our services are licensed cannabis growers in California.

As Central CA Field Operations Manager, you will be responsible for managing daily operations and activities including engaging with customers, coordinating site surveys, managing subcontractors, overseeing the installation of production systems, and generally helping to develop the business in California with a specific focus on customer satisfaction as a top priority. Your area of focus will be Central California counties from Santa Cruz, to Santa Barbara county, though work anywhere in California may be required depending on the needs of the business.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Become an SME (Subject Matter Expert) on the AG Gas system and the benefits of CO2 enrichment.

Provide local company representation and service to customers in region.

Generate and execute installation plans for each customer site.

Monitor and maintain the integrity of the sensors collecting system performance data at customer sites.

Perform customer site surveys and advise suitability for installation of Carbogation systems. Advise customers on ways to make the site more suitable for CO2 deliveries and installation.

Develop relationships and manage third party suppliers in region to provide installation and customer service.

Provide project management for each system installation in alignment with company process and procedures.

Adhere to and enforce all company safety policies and procedures.

Balance quality, productivity, cost, safety and morale to achieve results and work to continuously improve in all areas.

Help develop and implement operational processes and best practices within the organization.

Willingness to commute across the Central California territory and, as necessary, travel for multiple days at a time for customer installations across the state.

QUALIFICATIONS

This position requires:

3+ years of hands-on work experience in an agricultural or skill-based application such as machine operation, construction, or similar trades. Experience with greenhouse environmental control system is strongly preferred.

Excellent interpersonal communication skills with individuals internal and external to the company including customers and vendors.

Demonstrated ability to manage and maintain an organized schedule to prioritize and manage multiple projects at the same time, and tasks within each project.

Safety oriented – capable of developing, implementing, and enforcing safety protocols.

Demonstrated ability to lead people and achieve results through others including employees and subcontractors.

Demonstrated hands-on ability to analyze and solve problems.

Clean DMV record.

Fluency conversing in Spanish strongly preferred, but not required.

Reliable transportation is required for commuting to job sites.

COMPUTER SKILLS:

To perform the job successfully, an individual should possess proficient skills in MS Excel, Word, and Outlook applications with a proficiency for online research as a method of problem solving.

Data Engineer

The data team designs, implements and scales data pipelines that transform raw data into actionable models and metrics that enable insight. This team owns the pipelines that transport and process database data from all of Asana's product surfaces. We build and operate the infrastructure and services that ensure data accuracy and data availability for data scientists, analysts, and business and product teams.

We are looking for a data engineer to found our product data engineering team. This team will have ownership of the core data pipelines powering Asana's metrics and partner with our existing data infrastructure team, data science team, and cross-functional partners to help evolve our analytic data model as data volume grows and new needs arise to support the growth of the business.

What you'll achieve
Architect, build, and launch scalable data pipelines to support Asana's growing data processing and analytics needs. Some upcoming projects you may work on include designing and implementing pipelines that deliver data with high quality, consistency, and timeliness. Evangelize high-quality software engineering practices for building data infrastructure and pipelines at scale.
Produce foundational data tables and metrics with clear definitions, lineage, and test coverage to ensure that data is reliable, intelligible, and maintainable
Understand and influence logging frameworks and practices to support our data flow, architecting logging best practices where needed
Implement systems to track data quality and consistency
Partner with business domain experts, data scientists and analysts, and engineering teams to build a roadmap for foundational data sets that are aligned with business goals and that enable self-service. Some upcoming projects you may work on include evolving data models and schemas based on business, product, and engineering needs to facilitate data-driven decisions and features across Asana. Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources; develop relationships with product engineering teams to manage our analytic data model as the Asana product evolves.
About you
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering, or a related quantitative field, or equivalent experience
5+ years of industry experience in software engineering or data engineering
Experience using coding languages Python, Java, Scala
Experience using workflow management engines (e.g. Airflow, Luigi, Prefect, Dagster, digdag.io, Google Cloud Composer, AWS Step Functions, Azure Data Factory, UC4, Control-M)
Experience with Hadoop or similar ecosystem (MapReduce, Yarn, HDFS, Hive, Spark, Presto, Pig, HBase, Parquet)
Effective in working across team boundaries to establish overarching data architecture, and provide guidance to individual teams
Expertise in relational databases and query authoring (SQL)
About us

At Asana, we're building a better way to work, fueled by transparency, inclusion, and technology that is a force for positive change. Asana is a work management platform that helps teams orchestrate their work, from daily tasks to strategic initiatives, so they can move faster and accomplish more with less. For the past 5 years, we've been named a top workplace, including top 10 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces, #1 Fortune Best Workplaces in the Bay Area, #8 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, and one of Ireland's Best Workplaces. With offices all over the world, we are always looking for curious, collaborative, and mission-driven people to help us enable the world's teams to work together effortlessly.

We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of any educational background, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, and veteran status.

Job Description:

The Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco (the “Bank”) is a cooperative, wholesale bank that provides liquidity to its members and helps meet community credit needs by providing credit products and services to member financial institutions through all phases of the economic cycle. The Bank’s members include commercial banks, credit unions, industrial loan companies, savings institutions, insurance companies, and community development financial institutions headquartered in Arizona, California, and Nevada. The Bank is member focused; embraces accountability to meet commitments and uphold our governance, risk and control standards as a government sponsored enterprise; and values differences to foster an inclusive culture.

Member and Collateral Review is a team within the Credit and Collateral Risk Management Department and is responsible for (1) managing the risk of accepting mortgage loans as collateral pledged to secure Bank advances through the evaluation of pledged mortgage portfolios and the assessment of the borrowers’ credit management and real estate operations. (2) implementation of the Bank’s collateral risk management policies and procedures for monitoring pledged mortgages for assigned caseload of members to ensure the adequacy and liquidation value of pledged mortgages collateralizing advances. (3) performing quarterly sample price adjustments to real estate loans market values to establish borrowing capacity for borrowers’ residential, multifamily and commercial loans. (4) managing the pledge programs and ensure the execution of borrower and third-party agreements are proper to perfect the Bank’s secured interest in pledged collateral. (5) Manage the approval and monitoring of borrowers’ third-party custodians and servicers. (6) managing liquidation of loan collateral. (7) producing mortgage asset risk analytics for credit and collateral management

As an Individual Contributor, the Collateral Asset Manager, Sr. Associate, has primary responsibility for conducting on-site collateral verification reviews, quantifying and reporting the risk metrics associated with pledged mortgage loan collateral. Responsibilities associated with this function include but are not limited to: mortgage asset valuation, borrower mortgage operations assessment, third party servicer and custodian assessment, credit trend analysis, loan collateral scenario stress testing and forecasting. This responsibility also includes independently performing risk and economic stress analysis that support the Bank’s Credit and Collateral Risk Management functions.

Major Accountabilities :

Responsible for implementation of the Bank’s risk management policies and procedures for monitoring pledged mortgages for assigned caseload of members to ensure the adequacy of pledged mortgages to collateralize advances.
Conduct on-site collateral verification reviews to assess assigned borrowers’ loan origination, servicing, custodian and credit and collateral management operations; lending strategies and policies; and the mortgage collateral pledged to the Bank.
Prepare member collateral verification field review results reports for management that provide an evaluation of the member’s lending operations and collateral eligibility, and make recommendations for collateral margins, field review frequency, and any needed remedial actions.
Responsible for quarterly monitoring of borrowers’ risk profile utilizing member business risk matrix report, SNL data, blanket lien collateral reconciliations and portfolio stratification.
Responsible for assisting relationship managers and members in pledging eligible collateral to secure Bank advances for assigned caseload of members, as well as, the member’s lending strategies and collateral position.
Responsible for understanding how changes to policies and procedures, pricing engine coefficients, margin components, and real estate market risk impact the Bank’s collateral exposure risk,
Assist in preparing periodic reports for Senior Management which portray the safety, soundness and mix of associated risks of mortgages pledged to the Bank by its Borrower institutions.

Technical Skills/Knowledge :

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Real Estate, equivalent education or work experience, required.
Must have an expert understanding of real estate (commercial, multifamily and residential) loan underwriting.
Proficient in building SQL queries, Excel Macros, MS and Oracle databases, strongly desired
Minimum of 5 years of experience preparing, evaluating, or performing quality control on legal loan documents necessary to secure mortgage debt. Solid understanding of such legal instruments as a note, deed of trust, title insurance policy, mortgage insurance, and corporate assignment is required.
Understanding of market trends at sub-market level.
Understanding of servicing operations, custodian operations, lending laws (RESPA, TILA, APL) and loan documents, required.
Must be able to travel up to 65% of the time (primarily within California, Arizona, and Nevada).
Must be detail-oriented and able to interpret large amounts of real estate documentation to determine whether certain loans comply to the Bank’s collateral guidelines and to ensure that the Bank can perfect its ownership in the collateral.
Familiarity or experience with packaging collateral for loan sales in the secondary market to Investors, FNMA, or FHLMC is highly desired.
Excellent Microsoft Office application skills (e.g., Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) are required. Database report writer (Crystal, Infomaker) strongly preferred.
Must be able to comfortably interact with all functions and levels of personnel, both internal and external.
High level of professionalism, discretion, judgment, and initiative is required.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, as well as organizational skills, are required.
Ability to work well within a team environment as well as autonomously.

Qualifications:

The Federal Home Loan Bank of San Francisco is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse workforce. We value and actively seek to recruit, develop, and retain individuals with varied backgrounds and experiences reflecting the full diversity of the communities that we serve. It is the policy of the Bank to comply with all applicable laws concerning the employment of persons with disabilities.

Introduction to the role:

Thought leader and facilitator with wide breadth of scope, managing cross functional programs, driving planning strategy to improve scheduling and tool efficiencies. Critical proven activities should include OEE improvements, anticipation of cross functional business requirements, development of strategy for project execution, coordination of multi-echelon implementations, and full accountable for targeted business deliverables.
Position requires a holistic thinker, proven senior level facilitator across operations and supply chain, proven rapid transformations, and capability of highly effectively influence of leadership at both C-level and operational supervisor levels. Responsible for management of complex cross functional programs to successful and timely decision points supporting world class supply chain operations efficiency and capacity utilization.

ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

Develop and facilitate proposals, to support organizing and conducting relevant, concise, data driven, professional presentations to leadership with recommendations.
Demonstrated ability to translate strategy to action; Influence, negotiation, change mgt, and presentation.
Proven track record of high-quality strategic decision making with multi factory global impact.
Demonstrated project integration, planning, communication, and documentation skills to oversee and prepare project team resources requirements in collaboration with cross-functional departments.
Demonstrated success improving OEE, capacity planning, scheduling and production planning.
Experienced as lead with operational shop floor management, enterprise resource planning (ERP) tools, quality management, and quality metric methodology, including Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma.
Implementation of successful continuous improvement through Lean Leadership (Daily Management, Leader Standard Work, and Gemba Walks.)
Demonstrated success as technical expert in broad supply chain areas, supporting management, creative new solutions, and execution of wide breadth of initiatives.
Broad expertise in multiple supply chain disciplines, with broad expert knowledge across Operations, Logistics, Sales, Marketing, Finance, HR, and others.
Proven high level capability to concisely communicate complex and controversial issues.
Optimize cross functional resources to achieve complex and unique objectives within budget and timelines.
Proven track record of steering committee facilitation and communication of analytics, charter, processes, activities, decisions, and change. Ensures socialization and documentation.
Proven expertise with project management practices, tools, and methodology to manage complex project timelines and resources. Also, strategy deployment and value-stream mapping leadership.
Drives resolution to systemic supply chain issues affecting quality, cost, delivery, assets.

Doctoral degree in field with 3+ years of work experience.

Knowledge and skills:

Proficiency in MS Excel, MS Power Point, Agile.
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.

Summary

SUMMARY: Responsible for the day to day operations of facility wide utilization, discharge planning and care coordination.

DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: NOTE: The following are the duties performed by employees in this classification. However, employees may perform other related duties at an equivalent level. Not all duties listed are necessarily performed by each individual in the classification.
Assists Director in Establishing, implementing and ensuring that care management policies, practices and procedures are in accordance with the Joint Commission, Title 22 and other regulatory agencies and overall hospital policies.
Conducts and records periodic staff meetings, to inform staff of changes in policies and procedures.
Conducts interdepartmental team conferences for identifying aberrant utilization; establishes a method of tracking variances based on critical timelines.
Develops and provides statistical UM information and reports to appropriate committees and in conjunction with the Director of Care Management identifies utilization issues affecting the quality of patient care.
Direct and coordinate data gathering and record keeping legally required by Federal and State agencies, the Joint Commission, and hospital policies; participates in the risk mitigation, process of implementing new or revised processes, and projects.
In conjunction with VP and Director, coordinates, develops, and implements action plans to respond to areas felt to be in need of improvement related to patient flow and care coordination across the continuum.
Manages and assumes responsibility for day to day operations of utilization management, care coordination and discharge planning activities.
Manages process of pre-admission review of questionable admissions as referred by Admitting, Emergency Room and medical staff and offers workable solutions.
Oversees submission of any audits, including but not limited to MediCal, Medicare and internal compliance studies.
Oversees the secondary review process; actively appeals denied cases when necessary and assists physicians with appeals. Maintains minimal denial rates by Medicare, MediCal, private and contracted payors through appropriate direction of utilization practices; assists physicians and hospital personnel in understanding care management issues.
Perform all other duties as assigned.
Performs daily clinical rounds and monthly audit of charts on care management activities (utilization review, discharge planning and Interrater Reliability).
Prepares cost analysis reports and other data needed for the preparation of the departmental budget.
Provides in house educational programs as needed for both staff and physicians.
Responsible for the recruitment, orientation, evaluation, counseling and disciplinary action of care management clinical and administrative staff.
Responsible to purchase, educate, and record education to new equipment and/or techniques.
Reviews cases regularly with staff; acts as clinical consultant regarding care management issues; guides clinical staff with review of assessments and care plans, evaluates utilization reviews or documentation.
Serves as a content expert to staff and internal departments and external partners; networks with other hospitals, nursing organizations, and professional organizations to keep abreast of changes within the profession.
Supervises technical procedures and performs procedures as needed.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Preferred Licenses/Certifications: Certification in Case Management, CCMC or ACM.

Preferred Education: Master’s in Nursing or Masters in Social Work or related field.

Required Experience: Five years of clinical nursing or social work experience in a directly related setting (e.g., acute care, skilled nursing, etc.); three years of case management experience; two years of experience in a supervisory or lead role.

Required Licenses/Certifications: Active licensure as a Registered Nurse in the State of California or licensed in Clinical Social Work in California, Active BLS - Basic Life Support Certification issued by the American Heart Association. Other advanced life support certifications may be required per unit/department specialty according to patient care policies. CPI -Crisis Prevention Intervention Training.

Job Title: Program Manager for Substance Use Disorder Treatment Programs

Job Description:
About us:
Grand Rounds is a new kind of healthcare company. Founded in 2011, the company is on a mission to raise the standard of healthcare for everyone, everywhere. The Grand Rounds team goes above and beyond to connect and guide people to the highest quality healthcare available for themselves and their loved ones. Grand Rounds creates products and services that give people the best possible healthcare experience. Named a 2019 Best Place to Work by Glassdoor and Rock Health’s 2018 Fastest Growing Company, Grand Rounds works with inspiring employers and doctors to empower them to be the change agents we need to make our shared vision a reality.

We are looking for a product minded senior engineering leader with passion for frontend and mobile engineering to lead and mentor our Member Experience Engineering Team. The right person will be a seasoned organizational and people leader, with experience growing teams and delivering impactful work.

The ideal candidate will not only have broad engineering experience, but will be passionate about emerging technologies, engineering and technology best practices, recruiting and building top performing, happy and motivated teams.
Responsibilities:
Lead the Grand Rounds Member Experience Engineering team through its next phase of growth.
Hire, retain and grow amazing engineering technical talent for Grand Rounds.
Play a key role during the creative process, setting the technical vision and leading technical decisions (including all associated functional areas) to ensure the team writes great, simple, clean, and efficient code to create intuitive / beautiful products
Ability to be hands on as and when needed. Not afraid to dig into code, do code reviews as well as critique architecture and technical design
Understand the Grand Rounds set of products, partner with other engineering teams, data science, product and other relevant teams to create solutions for specific customer implementations.
Build and grow a customer centric, engineering organization that will match the scale and growth of Grand Rounds. Communicate regular updates to internal stakeholders.
Qualifications:
A visionary leader with the ability to inspire engineering professionals to succeed in a fast changing and highly competitive market, keeping the team focused on breakthrough strategies and tactics to best leverage the resources of a fast growing company all the while encouraging a “mission-first” mentality.
A mature understanding of how to create a scalable product while keeping our member experience in mind every step of the way.
Proven ability to lead and mentor a highly technical engineering team while also demonstrating the ability to discuss, understand and synthesize solutions for the business needs and data management requirements of other organizational units.
Ability to collaborate with business unit leadership as well as individual members of the team with strong empathy, and ability to creatively problem solve.
Possess the ability to bring clarity when faced with ambiguity, while motivating and leading team contributors through complex problem domains.
Willing to be flexible in search of generating the desired results while still leading with a bias for action. Excellent communication skills - both written and verbal.
Entrepreneurial thinker; ability to innovate, think outside the box.
As an experienced leader, the qualified candidate will have had significant engineering experience with technical depth and breadth.
Previous work experience should include projects which have built and delivered high-throughput high-capacity, secure data acquisition, processing and management systems.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science, Information Science disciplines, or comparable STEM related degree, Master’s degree (MBA or Technical) preferred.
Minimum of 5 years experience as an organizational and people leader.

Background*
WomenServe (WS) is a Sonoma County-based nonprofit on a mission to unlock the potential of women and girls in Western Rajasthan, India by increasing access to water, health and hygiene, education, and economic empowerment. We partner with non-profit organizations, impact funds and social innovators to build individual and community power by securing access to resources that fuel sustainable change. WomenServe advocates for more than 25,000 people in rural communities in India, contributing to gender parity and greater community self-reliance.
Summary*
We are looking for an enthusiastic and highly coordinated E-Commerce Operations Manager to develop and execute our company's e-commerce strategy. Reporting to and in partnership with the Director of Operations and Founder/Executive Director (ED), this new full-time role will have the opportunity to build and grow the e-commerce function of WS. Your work will directly impact how WomenServe performs and achieves important goals for our mission, future growth, and sustainability.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities *
Strategic Planning | E-Commerce | Marketing | Analysis & Reporting

Strategic Planning
Own and deliver the operational plans for e-commerce functional areas, including operations, customer service, creative, supply chain, warehouse operations, and operational goals for inbound and outbound inventory
Responsible for providing and achieving strategic level/long-term planning (3, 6, and 12 months out) for WomenServe’s e-commerce function
Drive continuous improvement projects to optimize operations and improve productivity to meet and exceed business objectives
Develop and execute an annual operating plan
E-Commerce & Marketing
Own and execute daily e-commerce operations from ‘nuts to bolts’ - through the product and customer lifecycle, including but not limited to procurement, fulfillment, product inventory, online customer service, quality control, sales channel management, product returns, and vendor management
Perform data entry and provide inventory reports to management
Develop processes for using data, information systems, and metrics around financial, brand, and shopper trends to maximize market share, sales, and profits
Create and execute social media and digital marketing strategies, including development of social content and digital ads to build brand awareness, engagement, and sentiment
Implement processes and procedures to drive efficiency and suggest improvements
Partner with web developers to ensure optimal site performance, develop new initiatives and drive online excellence
Manage all e-commerce account financials including margins and targets
Analysis & Reporting
Provide and explain market data to the ED
Collaborate with other team members to solicit and share process improvements and drive efficiencies and cost savings
Establish objectives and metrics for product quality, productivity, and customer experience
Analyze traffic to inform website maintenance and the effectiveness of marketing strategies
Key Qualifications

We seek a driven individual to help develop this role from scratch and scale it as we grow. You should be able to perform at a high level without micro-management.
Willing to wear many hats
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing Management, Information Systems, or similar
5+ years of direct and hands-on experience in e-commerce, sales and/or channel marketing

Experience developing and managing budgets
Ability to operate independently given direction, and bring ideas and solutions to issues raised
Ability to analyze and assess organizational needs and provide solutions accordingly
Interpersonal savvy; an ability to effectively work with and connect with all levels of employees across multiple functions and geographies
Strong project planning, tracking & organizing skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; must be able to present data in an organized manner

Position Summary*: The Case Manager for Housing Navigation provides assistance and support to assigned clients (individuals/families) experiencing homelessness. Support includes: housing sustainability assessments, increasing income, accessing housing assistance programs (e.g. utility arrear programs, eviction prevention resources), and linkage to housing retention resources within the community.
Case Managers engage in client interview assessments, create case plans, facilitate goal setting, etc. Within their initial review period trainings and certifications as required housing navigation activities will include determining and referring to appropriate assistance including but not limited to access rental subsidy assistance to obtain long-term housing; facilitation of counseling and program/assistance education; guiding participants with the development, implementation and monitoring of individualized opportunity plans; providing assistance with finding and accessing appropriate housing resources and assisting participants with identifying and overcoming any barriers to access services and achieving goals. Target populations are identified and referred to Case Managers through coordinated entry, as well as from internal programs and outside agencies *and may require travel and/or conversations over the phone to meet clients within an assigned program site. *The Case Manager works with internal, network, and external partners, maintain professional relationships and communicate effectively through shared tools provided by the agency.
Typical Duties Include (but are not limited to): *
Levels I and II:

Conduct screening and assessment with participants with the objective of determining housing barriers, and appropriate housing intervention.

Divert or link/schedule individuals and families with the appropriate housing-focused resource/service.

Practice assertive engagement with individuals and families through persistent and creative engagement to motivate, encourage participation, and promote follow-through.

Provide team support to supervisor, shelter staff, and navigator counterparts to support participant’s success.

Document service encounters as required, input data in a timely manner in Homeless Management Information System (HMIS), excel spreadsheets, smartsheets, and/or case management database as program requires.

Respond to calls, emails, update requests and other inquiries in a professional and timely manner.

Complete required trainings and certifications within the established time period.

Perform other related duties as assigned.

Level II

Complete more than one training and/or certification to be able to provide specialized services.

Serve on an agency or community service committee representing the department and/or organization.

Conduct case management related duties independently, exercises sound professional and case management judgement, minimal documentation errors and/or corrective actions.
Education, Experience, and Skills Required: *
Fluency in English/Spanish REQUIRED*
High School Diploma required, Associate's degree/Bachelor’s degree, or related social service certificate highly desirable

One to two (1 - 2) years previous experience working as a Housing Case Manager, or related/equal work experience require

Strong written and verbal communication skills in both English and Spanish; organizational, conflict resolution and computer literacy

Prior experience and understanding of causes of homelessness; experience working within social services.

Knowledge of Housing First principles and methods and have a working knowledge of community resources.

Cooperative, friendly, and helpful attitude with clients and co-workers. Ability to work closely with other employees to ensure positive, constructive environment within the program or department, and throughout the agency.

Ability to thrive in a flexible, fast-paced and growth-oriented environment, while maintaining a sense of humor and a positive, solution-oriented approach.

Ability to work under pressure. Experience in crisis intervention and problem solving with ability to diffuse situation without heightening the conflict.

Have a passion and enthusiasm for the mission of CCDSR and its clients.
Possess valid driver's license, and at least state required minimum of auto insurance REQUIRED. Must be willing and able to travel/drive throughout Sonoma County.*
Computer literacy required, including experience with Excel, Outlook, Word, etc.
Must pass fingerprinting and background/reference checks as a condition of employment.*
Must pass English/Spanish fluency testing as a condition of employment for this position.*
Agency Culture: * The business and social environment we operate in has changed. What worked yesterday may not work today and will likely not work tomorrow. To thrive, we must incorporate new ways of thinking and embrace new practices. As part of our individual and agency cultural change process, it is critical that all employees of Catholic Charities aspire to the following:
· A commitment to the agency’s mission, vision, and values;

· A commitment to excellence in everything we do;

· A commitment to accreditation as well as performance and quality improvement;

· A commitment to outcomes and measured results;

· A commitment to innovation and to what is possible.
Physical Requirements: *
· Requires ability to sit up to 3-6 hours per day with intermittent occasional walking, standing, bending, squatting and climbing.

· Occasionally may be required to lift items up to 10 pounds to a height up to 7 feet.

· Occasionally may be required to carry items up to 10 pounds for distances up to 50 feet.

Job Description:
Our Crowe San Francisco and Sacramento offices are growing. We’re looking for future leaders, which means Partner career path for you. Are you up for the challenge?

As an Audit Manager on our fun, close-knit audit team, this is what your work entails:

Taking responsibility of client relationships with a variety of clients to build positive relationships.
Managing multiple teams and providing performance feedback to all members of those teams when engagements end. That takes dedication, but we believe in you and value your feedback.
Anticipating and addressing client concerns and resolving problems as they arise.
Promoting new ideas and business solutions that result in extended services to existing clients. We encourage you to be creative and become an expert so that you can make a difference at our firm.
Continue learning the latest developments and the firm's standards and policies.
Staying on top of industry developments and their effects on client's competitive position.
.

Qualifications
5 to 7 years of recent public accounting external audit experience.
Your background should have experience in external audit of commercial services clients. SEC experience preferred.
Your skills should include organization, communication, technical, time management, and accounting and auditing as you work effectively with clients and adequately handle multiple engagements and teams.
It is important that you interact with clients, prospects, all levels of staff, and colleagues in a professional fashion.
You will need to be able to multi-task since planning, executing, and wrapping up various engagements may have to be performed concurrently.
We require experience supervising engagement team members and instructing them on completing assigned task.
This position requires you to be a licensed CPA in the state of California or be able to be licensed in California.
Ability to work additional hours as needed and travel to various client sites.

For this specific opportunity, we are seeking talented professionals for full-time or seasonal work arrangement options.

About the Team:

The Audit team at Crowe provides traditional attestation services as well as accounting and consulting on applying accounting principles. Audit professionals demonstrate deep specialization through an understanding of the market and business challenges their clients face and a commitment to audit quality. Though Crowe has six different business units, Audit is the largest practice. As for the Financial Services practice, Crowe is ranked #1 nationally for the number of audits for publicly traded financial institutions, according to SNL data. Learn more about our Audit team!

Our Benefits:

At Crowe, we know that great people is what makes a great firm. We value our people and offer employees a comprehensive benefits package. Learn more about what working at Crowe can mean for you!

How You Can Grow:

We will nurture your talent in an inclusive culture that values diversity. You will have the chance to meet on a consistent basis with your Career Coach that will guide you in your career goals and aspirations. Learn more about where talent can prosper!

More about Crowe:

Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.

EOE

M/F/D/V

We are looking for an energetic person who is enthusiastic about our mission, works with a sense of urgency, thrives in a fast-paced work environment, and is committed to our vision of a progressive, best practice, data driven, no-kill cat shelter and spay/neuter clinic. We are seeking an Operations Manager who embraces change and growth, loves to learn and brings a positive and open- minded attitude to every challenge.

The Operations Manager will be responsible for leading a team of staff and volunteers as we provide the highest level of care to our cats and offer exceptional customer care and support to our community. This will be an opportunity to oversee and lead the day-to-day operations of our low-cost cat clinic and our adoption center, ensuring the physical and psychological welfare of all cats and operational effectiveness. The Operations Manager will develop, implement, and assure compliance with a wide range of policies and protocols, as well as identify and implement operational best practices.

With the upcoming retirement of our Founder and Chief Veterinarian, Nine Lives is going through a phase of transition. We currently offer services that include intake of and medical care for at-risk cats, and make them available for adoption.
As part of the transition, we are resuming low-cost spay/neuter services, primarily for community cats (TNR) and local cat rescues, after suspending those services in recent months due to the illness of our Chief Veterinarian. And, we will continue to find homes for cats currently in our care. Over the next several months and years the actual services that Nine Lives offers are likely to evolve with some balance of spay/neuter services and the intake and adoption of cats. Therefore, the Operations Manager role will evolve.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES *
The role may include the following responsibilities (may not be an exhaustive list): *
 Work collaboratively with all staff members
 Oversee day-to-day operations of the low-cost cat clinic and adoption center, which includes scheduling (cats and people), customer service and billing
 Develop and ensure maintenance of proper protocols for facilities and kennel cleaning; cat handling, care and feeding for staff and volunteers to follow
 Liaise closely with the Clinic Operations Supervisor (who manages scheduling of care/cleaning staff) to ensure appropriate coverage
 Liaise closely with bookkeeper on budgeting, accounts receivable and payable
 Oversee the provision of best practice care to all cats in Nine Lives’ care, including but not limited to the following:
Kennel cleaning
Administering medications (following direction from the veterinary staff)
Animal socializing and enrichment
Movement of cats into/from treatment areas and adoption rooms
Monitoring of the number of cats in care and available capacity
 Pursue and maintain relationships with rescue partners
 Coordinate operational aspects of the Spay/Neuter clinic
Determine capacity on a daily basis
Implement scheduling and appointment processes
Communicate new processes to partner rescue groups, trappers and the community
 Manage intake of animals, follow guidelines and capacity constraints agreed upon veterinary staff
Identify which cats Nine Lives can intake from rescue partners and other sources
Coordinate transport and intake
Ensure newly-arrived cats are suitably kenneled upon arrival
 Manage exits of adopted animals
Coordinate with veterinary staff and front desk to ensure that animals are exited on a timely basis and that adopter communication is effective
 Manage the logistical aspects of the Foster Program
Identify and assign foster homes for cats and kittens based on needs (e.g., bottle kittens, moms with kittens, adult cats)
Track cats going into and returning from foster homes
Provide reporting on projected number kittens returning from foster and requiring spay/neuter and other services before the cats are made available for adoption
2
Ensure foster check-ups are scheduled on a timely basis
Monitor the status of cats in long-term foster homes
Ensure adequate supplies are available for foster families
 Manage the reporting of key statistics including:
Intake and outcomes, compliant with the Shelter Animal Count data reporting requirements
Number of cats in care
Average days in shelter
Foster statistics
Inventory and usage of shelter supplies
Spay/Neuter statistics
 Maintain animal information in automated systems; assist with the implementation of new systems and enhancements to automated systems

 Provide management and operational support to programs including strategic planning, budgeting, volunteer management and fostering

 Provide assistance with HR/Management protocols, ensuring that Nine Lives is legally compliant in staffing practices

 Work closely with the Board of Directors and veterinarians to identify priorities, set goals, and implement programs, and support transition activities as the vision and role of Nine Lives evolve

 Support the Board in identifying and applying for grants, and fundraising
 Provide timely performance feedback to kennel care/cleaning staff in both a positive and coaching light as needed; draft and deliver corrective action as needed

 Perform other duties as assigned
EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS*
 Proven ability to handle all aspects of prior job duties and executing them to satisfaction
 Minimum of 3 years animal-related experience in sheltering or other animal field
 Staff and volunteer supervision experience required
 Animal handling experience in an animal shelter, rescue, veterinary office, training or boarding facility
 Experience in fear-free animal handling protocols preferred
 Knowledge of animal welfare and feline health issues
 Comfortable handling cats

2

 Understanding of, and commitment to, mission, vision and values of the Nine
Lives Foundation and the No Kill movement

 Excellent time management, multi-tasking and problem-solving skills
 Motivated self-starter with great attitude, flexibility, and entrepreneurial spirit
 Ability to excel in an unstructured environment and both initiate and execute the creation of protocols, processes, procedures and support materials where none exist

 Strong interpersonal and communication skills and ability to interact positively with a wide variety of personalities

 Bilingual (English & Spanish) preferred but not required
 Must love cats
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT*
 Physical requirements include lifting and carrying up to 30 pounds. Subject to kneeling, lifting, sitting, standing, stooping, bending, and walking to perform the essential functions

 While performing the duties of this job, the employee is exposed to hazards associated with aggressive patients; hazards associated with infected animals and controlled substances; exposure to unpleasant odors and noises; exposure to bites, scratches and animal waste; possible exposure to contagious diseases
WORK SCHEDULE *
 Mondays through Fridays, some weekends

WestEd is a nonpartisan, nonprofit agency that conducts and applies research, develops evidence-based solutions, and provides services and resources in the realms of education, human development, and related fields, with the end goal of improving outcomes and ensuring equity for individuals from infancy through adulthood. WestEd has more than a dozen offices nationwide, from Massachusetts, Vermont, Georgia, and Washington, DC, to Arizona and California, with headquarters in San Francisco.

Department or Program Profile:
The WestEd Center for Child and Family Studies is the home of the California Department of Education Desired Results Training and Technical Assistance Project and the California Preschool Instructional Network Project. The DRTTA project is specifically aimed at improving quality in state-funded center-based programs and family child-care home networks. CPIN provides professional development to administrators and preschool teachers in the Preschool Learning Foundations and related publications, including English Language learners and preschool children with disabilities.

Brief Position Description:
The Project Manager for CPIN and CECO will work directly with the Project Director in the creation, review, and editing of CPIN and CECO materials, modules, and job aids. This includes extensive development and management of online modules, online conference centers, coordination and training of CPIN Leads and instructors, including the CPIN Core Curriculum as part of the certification process. The Project Manager will also coordinate Cal-Pro Net activities, working closely with the CDE Nutritional Services Division.

Responsibilities:
Provide professional learning to CPIN Leads and instructors on new and existing materials.
Collaborate in the development of professional learning materials.
Collaborate with researchers on presenting and review of materials.
Align project materials with other state initiatives.
Manage the logistics of project activities for CECO, Cal-Pro Net, and CPIN.
Manage ongoing California Workforce Registry activities for projects.
Ongoing communication with CDE contract monitors and County Office Personnel.
Coordinate event planning and materials preparation for meetings, webinars, and trainings (virtual and when applicable, in-person) (10-200+ participants)
Conduct and coordinate meetings, webinars, and trainings (virtual and when applicable, in-person) across staff and clients from multiple locations
Coordinate monthly project status reports using report templates and protocols combining data from multiple sources and staff
Create on-line surveys including developing draft content with staff input and analyze survey results (i.e., SurveyMonkey)
Manage posting and removal of materials to project websites
Conduct activities collaboratively with project team members, contribute proactively to team discussions, and contribute to process improvements
Qualifications:
Masters' degree in child development, early childhood education, or related field
Teaching experience (Infant/toddler/preschool/school-age) or equivalent
Early childhood leadership experience
Extensive familiarity with state and national early childhood initiatives and research
Experience developing online courses and/or resources including course management systems and software such as Articulate Storyline
Familiarity with CPIN modules and the CDE Foundations and Frameworks publications
Familiarity with Quality Counts California
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Strong command of oral and written language
Ability to work independently and as a team member
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities
Ability to interact with a variety of internal and external groups and clients
Skill in the use of computer and information technology
High comfort level with ambiguity
Ability to travel
Experience leading webinars and/or training through Zoom.
This is a salary level G position. Compensation is competitive depending on experience.

*Note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Successful candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.

SPECIAL NOTICE REGARDING THE WORK LOCATION OF THIS POSITION - Currently, all staff at WestEd are working from home until further notice. Once we return to offices, this position will be based in one of WestEd’s offices. Candidates can submit a request to work from home.

#TeamNextdoor


Nextdoor is the neighborhood hub for you, your neighbors and the broader local community. Nextdoor's purpose is to cultivate a kinder world where everyone has a neighborhood they can rely on.

Building connections in the real world is a universal human need. That truth, and the reality that neighborhoods are one of the most important and useful communities in our lives have been guiding principles for Nextdoor. Today, neighbors rely on Nextdoor in neighborhoods around the world in the United States, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark, Australia and Canada, with many more to come.

Meet your Future Neighbors


Neighborhood Operations is a collaborative team obsessed with operational excellence and bringing the Voice of the Customer to improve our products. We're looking for a Senior Manager of Training and Quality who will be responsible for directing, planning, organizing, and coordinating all aspects of our Training and Quality Assurance program.

The Impact You'll Make


Your team is entrusted with building the foundation of knowledge for the Neighborhood Operations team by supporting the on-boarding learning experience of our frontline agents, optimizing training processes based on different learning modalities, and building quality programs to enable the best-in-class customer experience.

Drive improvements across both Training and Quality to reduce agent errors, improve information retention, and increase overall operational effectiveness

Influence cross functional partners in policy decision-making processes based on training needs analysis

3+ years of directly managing a Training and Quality team

Experience working with outsourced vendors is desired
An exceptional written and verbal communicator that can pass down information and instruction with great clarity.
Analytical, with a data-informed approach to management and decision making

Employees working as Quality Specialists in the Quality Assurance department report to the Quality Manager or Designee. The Quality Specialist role presents the employee with an opportunity to both learn the skills required to advance in the field of quality assurance and at the same time play a crucial role in the company’s long-term success. Software Engineer, Data Infrastructure

The Data Infrastructure team builds the infrastructure responsible for consuming, exposing and creating product and product-derived datasets. Our team owns the pipelines that transport and process database data from all of Asana's product surfaces. We build and operate the infrastructure and services that ensure data accuracy and data availability for stakeholders in Data Science, Business and feature teams.

We're looking for an Infrastructure Engineer to build and operate software to make Asana secure, scalable and fast. You will work with the team on deploying and operating existing systems, and build and support platforms and tools that provide high leverage to data consumers.You will guide users of Asana data to use these platforms effectively and champion adopting best practices and better technologies to improve the efficiency, scalability, and stability of our offerings.

What you'll do
Design, build, and operate streaming and batch services used by all of Asana
Collaborate on scaling the core data pipeline and scaling up data processing to meet the rapid data growth at Asana
Design and implement tooling and automation for clustering, scaling, monitoring and alerting
Participate in the on-call rotation, investigate and resolve production problems
About you
Like to leave code better than you found it
Are looking for an environment where you and your teammates empower one another to become the best versions of yourselves
A strong interest in building scalable and performant distributed systems with a focus on eliminating risks
Experience working in large, high-quality codebases
Experience in developing ETL jobs using a distributed processing framework
Experience with our tech stack - Scala, Python, Spark, Airflow, Kubernetes, AWS-based infrastructure
Does the above sound like it might be you? Then we'd love to hear from you. Our goal is to provide a hiring and working experience in which all people know they are equally respected and valued. So whatever it is that makes you unique—your gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, educational background, socioeconomic status—we value it, and we'd love to see what you might add to our team.

About us

At Asana, we're building a better way to work, fueled by transparency, inclusion, and technology that is a force for positive change. Asana is a work management platform that helps teams orchestrate their work, from daily tasks to strategic initiatives, so they can move faster and accomplish more with less. For the past 5 years, we've been named a top workplace, including top 10 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces, #1 Fortune Best Workplaces in the Bay Area, #8 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, and one of Ireland's Best Workplaces. With offices all over the world, we are always looking for curious, collaborative, and mission-driven people to help us enable the world's teams to work together effortlessly.

We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of any educational background, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, and veteran status.

_The Company _*
The world is facing a medical crisis, bacteria are increasingly evolving resistance to even our strongest antibiotics. The problem is already very real and immediate; for example, bloodstream infection leading to sepsis is now responsible for more than half of all deaths in hospitals and is the most expensive condition treated in hospitals. The sepsis mortality rate increases >6% every hour without effective antibiotic treatment. Yet, despite the life and death urgency, and healthcare cost impacts, current methodologies require 3 days to determine the correct antibiotic.

Specific Diagnostics has developed a breakthrough solution to rapidly determine the effective antibiotic treatment for the bloodstream and other acute infections. Used for bloodstream infection Specific’s solution provides results 2 days sooner than existing methods, saving patients suffering from a drug-resistant infection.

We have been funded by nearly $30 M in non-dilutive government-sponsored research support and recently $17.5 M in venture capital. This is an opportunity to join us at an inflection point in our commercial growth as we bring our first key product to market and with recognition from major customers fueling an expansion of our staff.
_The Job_*
The central responsibility of the job is to build, deploy, and continue to improve the Quality Plan of the company. The key objective is to assure compliance with medical device quality standards including the manufacturing and development of FDA-regulated medical devices in an ISO 13485 quality environment.

The role includes creating an internal auditing schedule and performing audits as needed to monitor the effectiveness of the Quality Management System. As a quality leader, it will be your responsibility to assure employees at all levels are trained, that they have a good understanding of the QMS, and that they are using the system as intended. When deficiencies are found you will work with group leaders and team members to perform training and guidance in use of QMS procedures.

The company uses Arena QMS. The use of Arena and tools such as Jira for issue tracking will be a routine part of the job. The job also includes the creation of part documentation and implementation of first article inspection validation results and throughput.

_*You *_

You should be an expert in quality management systems with Administrative Level experience in Arena and medical devices. You should be able to work effectively across the organization with group leaders, scientists, engineers, and manufacturing employees. You must be able to work independently to identify non-conformities and take corrective actions. You should have the analytical skills to develop and analyze statistical data and product specifications to determine present standards and establish proposed quality and reliability expectancy of the finished product. You must have exceptional written, verbal, and presentation communication skills. You should have direct experience in the engineering development of software, test software, verification and validation of regulated medical devices and these qualifications:
Expert in ISO 13485 and other medical industry quality assurance codes and standards.
At least 3 years of working experience in ISO systems in a management/supervising position
ISO13485:x Auditing certificate. (Lead Auditor preferred)
Experience with FDA, GMP, EU Regulations is a plus.
Teamwork, leadership, information seeking, problem-solving, planning & organizing.
Must have prior experience or education in dealing with customer contacts, customer audits, and statistics.
Excellent skills on Windows, Word, Excel, Powerpoint and Outlook. –
Excellent command of English (speaking, listening, reading, writing)
(Note: There is no relocation assistance available at this time. There is no sponsorship available for this position at this time.)
