Airtable's mission is to democratize software creation and empower anyone to "create anything." Our customers use Airtable to develop custom solutions they need to fix inefficient processes, break down data silos, and unlock innovation across every department. Over 170,000 of the world's leading organizations use Airtable to change the way they work.

The marketing team is looking for a strategic Product Marketing Manager to scale Airtable's Self-Serve business, the entry point for all customers. In this role you will distill core differentiators for new and existing customers through compelling storytelling and education. You will partner cross-functionally to influence the road map, develop valuable customer journeys & content and demonstrate a clear vision of the "why" behind Airtable's product offerings.

This is an exciting opportunity to expand Airtable's customer base and leave an indelible mark on the history of Airtable.

What you'll do

Airtable is working on the next computer revolution: one where anyone even without technical training can create customized applications that fit their needs, build more interconnected teams, and take part in a growing community of people who share what they create. About the role

The Growth team is on a mission to get our product in the hands of the next 10 million members. We are looking for a Group Product Manager for the Growth Activation team. You will own the strategy, roadmap and execution of key Growth initiatives, as well as building and managing a team of PMs. In this role, you will reimagine the new user experience for the millions of people signing up for Chime every year. Your work will help define how new members are introduced to Chime's features, ensure that people get value from our product and ultimately help them lead healthier financial lives.

As Group Product Manager you will be focused on defining and optimizing the initial experience users have with our product. This includes optimizing our onboarding flows, improving our new user experience, and identifying the next set of new features that our new members need. You will be responsible for setting direction, driving the multi-year strategy through customer insights, quantitative analysis and AB testing.

In this role, you can expect to
Manage multiple growth areas and drive the strategy of our new member experience
Lead, manage and develop highly functional teams, ensuring detailed experimentation methodology and flawless execution that is scalable and sustainable.
Design experiments, tactics and timeline for initiative required to drive solve customer problems to drive business goals
Establish shared vision across the company by building consensus on priorities leading to product execution
Perform quantitative and qualitative research to identify product opportunities and prioritize your roadmap
Ship minimum-loveable-products that allow us to test our hypotheses while delivering a quality customer experience
Communicate product plans, benefits and results to all audiences - including Chime's Executive team
Partner with marketing, risk, compliance, engineering, design, QA, and analytics teams to build software collaboratively and inclusively
To thrive in this role, you have
A deep understanding of customer needs, and strong motivation to tackle their problems
Experience managing product teams and integrating a diverse set of partners and processes into a cohesive product
Proven leadership leading and growing a team of PM direct reports, including performance management. Experience with formal review cycles is a plus.
Strong analytical skills, competence in SQL, and experience with tools for doing data analysis
An owner's mindset - you don't shy away from the hard stuff
Experience conducting user research to educate product design and revolve their pain points
Strong collaboration skills in team environments but able to act quickly as the decision-maker

We created Chime because we believe everyone deserves financial peace of mind. By eliminating unnecessary fees and helping people grow their savings automatically, we've empowered millions of Americans to take control of their finances.

Chime is the largest and fastest-growing U.S. player in the challenger-banking space. Through our banking partners, we offer access to bank accounts with fee-free overdraft, provide members the chance to receive early access to their paychecks, help them improve their credit, and more!

Overview:

Looking to make an impact on the future of global commerce? Do you want to shape how millions of people buy, sell, and engage around the world?

We are looking for a highly driven product manager to join the Search Monetization team and develop the next generation of CPC (Cost Per Click) advertising products in eBay search. Our team sits on the cutting edge of search and advertising, and we are the biggest contributor towards building a multi-billion dollar advertising business. We have an ambitious mission of reinventing the ecommerce advertising landscape, and you will work on advancing our mission by building the CPC solution. The CPC product is a high priority investment that provides an opportunity for you to drive the strategy and make a big impact! You will excel in developing long-term product strategy, aligning different teams across the company, and also relentlessly executing the roadmap in close collaboration with science and engineering teams. This is a highly visible role and you will work closely with various teams within search and ads.

If you are passionate about Product Management and excited by the scale and technical complexity of e-commerce search and advertising then come join us!

Own product strategy and roadmap for CPC and other initiatives in Search Monetization
Develop near-term and long-term requirements for products which span search ranking, search engineering and search visualization
Prioritize product requirements based on opportunity analysis to build a detailed roadmap. Communicate the roadmap and success metrics to different teams
Lead the execution of your roadmap by working with data science and engineering teams. Build MVPs, iterate fast and be the champion of execution excellence
Conduct AB tests for launch candidates and work with analytics teams to measure the impact on success metrics.
Balance the often conflicting needs of eBays buyers, eBays sellers, and eBays need to grow the advertising business

+5 years of strong product management experience with at least 3 years in ecommerce marketplaces and/or digital advertising
Experience in developing CPC products in ecommerce search strongly preferred
Strong product sense - ability to understand consumer needs and figure simple ways to solve the needs
Data driven - ability to sift through substantial amounts of data and make bias free data driven decisions
Relentless execution - ability to ship quality products in a fast paced and iterative manner
Builds strong relationships across various orgs within eBay; an active listener and clear communicator; can lead by influence

About the Role:

In this role, you will be responsible for designing, managing, and improving our sales tools and overall tech stack. You have 5+ years of experience with the Salesforce platform.
You have a clear understanding of Salesforce’s technical capabilities and limitations.
Start-up mentality – ability to adapt quickly to changing environments.
Ability to multi-task and manage multiple priorities at once.
You are excited about focusing on the business side of technical problems.
You are curious, collaborative, detail-oriented, and self-motivated.
A passion to contribute to the continuous efforts to improve business and system processes.
A creative, structured, and deeply analytical approach to cut through ambiguity.
The ability to effectively communicate with business stakeholders, technical challenges and technical solutions in a business-friendly language.
You are comfortable facilitating meetings with senior and executive level leadership and being a partner in their decision-making.

Type of Employee: Full Time

Vocera delivers the leading platform for clinical communication and workflow. Our mission is to simplify and improve the lives of healthcare professionals, patients, and families while enabling hospitals to enhance quality of care and operational efficiency and humanize the healthcare experience. Hospitals and health systems around the world have selected our solutions to enable care teams to communicate and collaborate using smartphones or our hands-free, wearable Vocera Smartbadge and Vocera Badge. Our platform is interoperable with most clinical and operational systems used in hospitals. In addition to healthcare, Vocera is found in aged care facilities, veterinary hospitals, luxury hotels, retail stores, schools, power facilities, libraries, and more. Vocera is headquartered in San Jose, California, with offices in San Francisco, Indiana, Orlando, Canada, India, United Arab Emirates, Australia, and the United Kingdom. Learn more at www.vocera.com and follow @VoceraComm on Twitter.

Position Description: Vocera is seeking a results-driven Sr. Campaign Manager to plan, execute and analyze the results of integrated marketing campaigns that drive qualified leads and revenue. This individual will iterate on our persona engagement and create buyer journeys and cross-channel tactics to drive marketing qualified leads (MQL). The role will help support activities worldwide and ensure outbound programs are always improving and providing maximum returns. The role reports to the Director of Demand Generation and Digital Marketing.

Responsibilities
Effectively plan, execute and measure MQL focused marketing campaigns comprised of relevant themes, offers, assets and a mix of digital and in person touch points established for a persona engagement journey aligning to the purchase stage (awareness, consideration demand creation and loyalty)
Collaborate with internal teams to develop highly targeting and engaging content to be leveraged for awareness, lead generation and sales enablement
Serve as liaison to sales, management, and other marketing stakeholders. Lead initiatives from concept to execution which includes working with multiple stakeholders to deliver on tight deadlines.
Write and/or collaborate on marketing program content for emails, paid media, webinars, etc. across the buyer journey. Creating “kits”, rinse and repeat programs as appropriate.
Manage campaign performance to ensure goals are met. Proactively suggest improvements and execute changes to optimize campaigns.
Manage scorecard which measures campaign performance.
Competencies
Data oriented with a focus on driving outbound programs to support revenue goals. Experience in utilizing data for decision-making, objective setting, and to influence organizations.
Proven effective project management skills
Work collaboratively with diverse, global teams in a fast-paced environment
Strong team player who is creative, quality driven, adept at working with marketing systems, and self-motivated
Must be able to thrive wearing many hats and switch rapidly from strategy to execution
Have first-hand understanding of database optimization, segmentation and lead scoring including work on digital, paid media and multi-level email campaign design
Advanced communication skills and an exceptional focus on detail and quality
Ability to present to all employee through the executive level
Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising, or related field or equivalent
8+ years of relevant experience in high performing digital campaign environment ideally in healthcare or digital health
Proven experience working effectively within an enterprise marketing team
Demonstrated experience working on integrated marketing campaigns; knowledge of Sirius Decisions framework is a plus
Hands-on knowledge of enterprise level email marketing systems (i.e., Marketo, Hubspot, etc.) and Salesforce from campaign creation to execution and reporting
B2B software industry experience a plus
No travel required
Belief in Diversity
Vocera Communications is an Affirmative Action Employer committed to workforce diversity. Here at Berkeley Lights, we think cells are awesome! Cells are capable of manufacturing cures for diseases, fibers for clothing, energy in the form of biofuels, and food proteins for nutrition. So the question is, if nature is capable of manufacturing the products we need in a scalable way, why aren’t we doing more of this? Well, the answer is that with the solutions available today, it is hard. Berkeley Lights is here to change all of that! Our extremely sophisticated proprietary technology and Beacon® and LightningTM systems accelerate the rate researchers can discover and develop cell-based products in a fraction of the time and at a fraction of the cost of conventional, legacy research methods. Using our tools and solutions, scientists can find the best cells, the first time they look.

Our goal is to continue to collaborate with customers to drive the adoption of our technologies, making cell-based products and therapeutics more easily accessible the world over! You will play a major role here in the creation and development of these technologies as part of the program/project management team, and our success will depend on you! We have been changing how the world develops cell-based products since 2011, and now our family of over 200 employees welcomes you to consider joining us on this incredible journey.

As a Software Program Manager at Berkeley Lights, you will work with multi-disciplinary teams (including members from marketing, engineering, software, biology, chemistry, applications, and quality) with the goal of delivering breakthrough products, although you will be largely focused on software product development. Product scope and complexity will vary, but the development efforts will be fast-paced using unique, cutting edge technologies and approaches. You will work closely with the commercial team to ensure product/marketing requirements are sufficiently defined, then you will help design a cross functional team and oversee successful execution from concept to commercialization/delivery.
Responsibilities:
Work with marketing and technical experts to scope the project in terms of requirements, resource needs, and timelines.
Work with functional managers (we use a matrix org structure) to resource and build a team to meet the specifications within the agreed upon timeline and budget. The team size may vary between 3 people and up to 12; in all cases the team will be multidisciplinary and awesome.
Oversee the development of products to ensure product development procedures are followed.
Maintain project plans, timelines, lead core team meetings and own specific project deliverables.
Communicate progress to executive staff on a regular basis.
Provide and/or oversee documentation of each project including the design history file for products, quality documentation as well as customer-facing training and informational materials.

Position Requirements:

Software Engineering background with systems engineering experience.
Will be working directly with software team and you believe in the Agile methodology for software development. Must have experience working with Agile teams as a scrum master.
You have a strong appreciation for the complexities of integrating hardware and software system components and help teams make non-trivial tradeoffs.
Six-ish years relevant work experience working with interdisciplinary teams on complex instruments with life science applications, preferably as manager or program leader. You have brought several products from concept to market.
Ability to develop and manage timelines for multidisciplinary programs and meet or exceed expectations. Project management is a required skillset, but this role involves much more than Gantt charts. You are a leader that inspires teams to be greater than the sum of their parts.
Possess strong problem-solving skills, ideally in a structured format. Define risks or problems that warrant additional resources to complete programs on schedule. Work with team to use structured problem-solving techniques to remedy risks or problems quickly and remain on schedule. Deep down, you get a little excited when something breaks because you enjoy fixing things that appear unfixable.
Must be proficient with new product introduction (NPI) activities. This includes having the proper manufacturing, quality, process, test, and specification documentation released within the PLM, ERP, and CRM to facilitate the continued sustaining and support of your released products.
Communication, communication, communication. You will be communicating progress to internal management, including executives in the form of presentations, meetings, and reports. This doesn’t mean that you love meetings, rather you love efficient forms of communication which occasionally includes very short meetings.
Documentation: help to define, review and efficiently oversee key documentation for products, e.g. requirements, risk analysis, project plans, manuals, marketing collateral, etc.
Data driven attitude with strong data analysis skills. Sharing data in a format that is easy to interpret should come naturally to you. You often ask yourself, ‘what would Tufte do?’
Must be pro-active with strong prioritization, organization and project coordination skills.
Excel in small, motivated high-performance team with aggressive schedules. We like to move fast and remain agile – we will pivot if new data comes in suggesting a better path.
Work well across multiple disciplines and personalities. Teams will include mix of engineers and scientists, and you appreciate the differences in how scientists and engineers tackle problems and can use both approaches to maximize the results.

Job Title: Principal Product Manager - Android Compatibility & Security
Job Description:
Description
The Product Management team works closely with our engineers to guide products from conception to launch. As part of the Product Management team, you bridge the technical and business worlds as you design services that our customers love. You'll work with teammates from Engineering, Sales, Data Science, and User Experience and External Partners, to name just a few. You have a bias toward action and can break down complex problems into steps that drive product development at PayJoy speed. As a Product Manager, you will be a crucial part of defining PayJoy’s future.
In this role, you will contribute to the mission of delivering consumer finance at scale by managing the PayJoy Lock product, our core innovation. This means defining the vision and product strategy to launch highly impactful lock-based products on mobile, web and as an API.
One of the many reasons PayJoy develops innovative products is because of the collaborative work we do in Product Management. Our team works closely with creative, innovative engineers to design and develop technologies that enable consumer finance in emerging markets. We're responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle, focusing specifically on analyzing, positioning, defining, packaging and tailoring our solutions to all the markets where we do business.
Responsibilities
Understand markets, competition and customer/user requirements in depth.
Identify market opportunities, build business cases, and define product vision and strategy.
Work collaboratively with engineers and cutting edge technologies.
Manage product launches, working closely with PayJoy engineers, sales, and technical staff to develop and track release milestones and schedules for the many moving parts that need to come together.
Develop a plan with well-defined launch milestones.
Strong ability to communicate concisely verbally and in writing.
Manage communication of progress/status within the company and external to the team (customers, partners, etc.); escalate issues as necessary.
Assess the quality of releases through monitoring of incoming issues to identify quality issues and trends.
Develop vision and roadmap for the PayJoy Lock.
Ability to estimate product impact before launch at the feature level.
Ability to measure the impact of your launches.
Requirements
BA/BS degree in computer science or related technical field
7+ years of experience as a Product Manager including 2+ years managing B2B products
Experience launching products in the device management or mobile security space.
Experience launching Android apps
Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills.
Track record of leading cross-functional teams of highly talented individuals.
Desired Qualifications
Experience in successfully launching products with external technical partners.
Technical knowledge of the Android platform and ecosystem.
Experience building features to support security and privacy regulations.
Benefits
Company-funded health, dental, and vision insurance for employee and immediate family
Company-funded employee life and disability insurance
401k contribution
10 company holidays; 15 days vacation (20 at 3rd year); unlimited sick leave
Annual fitness benefit ($500); professional development benefit ($2000), and international travel benefit ($2000)
Commuter benefit
Headphone benefit
About PayJoy
PayJoy's mission is to deliver access to credit to the next billion people in emerging markets worldwide. Our unique mobile security technology creates collateral that enables customers to afford their first smartphone on credit and then allows them further access to credit to help weather life's unexpected financial surprises and climb the ladder of economic well-being.
Founded in 2015, today PayJoy has reached hundreds of thousands of customers in a dozen countries around the globe, from Mexico to Indonesia, India, Kenya, and Nigeria, and is on a strong growth path with support from major industry partners to bring credit to millions in 2020.

Do you want to work with your fellow owners? Rosendin is one of the largest electrical contractors in the United States employing over 7,000 people. APPLY TODAY!

The Data Center Project Manager is responsible for overseeing projects from planning through completion and ensuring client satisfaction by delivering unparalleled service. Provides overall project management support for several small to medium projects or on one very large project supporting senior project management.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES :

POSITION PURPOSE

The Regional Sales Manager position will be a field sales position with a primary goal of selling UV devices and service contracts to clients while supporting current customers in the field. Sell, message and market Tru-D SmartUVC to all hospitals, clinics, VAs and government targets and independent non-acute channels with interest in UV

Attend local and national trade shows to market and message the device and solution
Service and support local sites and understand infection prevention modalities at each site
Schedule appointments and field travel 4 days per week to call on current and prospective customers throughout assigned territory
Build relationships with multiple levels of influence to include Infection Prevention, EVS, Surgical Services, Operating Room managers and C-suites
Cold call to hospitals and identified targets
Coordinate customer requests with different Tru-D departments such as Program Management, Clinical, Marketing and service departments.
Assist with the installation and set-up of equipment as well as on-going training for current customers

Position Summary: *
Supervises and coordinates the activities of the laboratory staff. Directs the departmental activities, relative to the improvement of patient care, quality assurance and personnel performance. Maintains appropriate standards of quality; plans, directs and supervises all technical aspects of the department in regards to services, programs and the evaluation of the services. Responsible for the day-to-day operations of the department and for waived testing performed in the hospital and the clinics.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities: *
· Manages and directs the department’s administrative and financial functions.

· Prepares and is accountable for departmental operating budgets and the capital budget.

· Evaluates staff in accordance with performance standards in chemistry, microbiology, hematology, serology, immunology and blood bank.

· Supports a culture of safety and quality.

· Responsible for administrative direction: interviewing, hiring, orienting, in-services, performance evaluations and termination of employment.

· Resolves staff concerns at the departmental level, utilizing the grievance process as required.

· Ensures compliance with policies and procedures regarding department operations, fire safety, emergency management and infection prevention and control.

· Effectively and consistently communicates with staff and encourages interactive departmental meetings and discussions.

· Addresses complaints regarding Clinical Laboratory functions and works with supervisors to resolve the complaints.

· Designs lab requisitions and coordinates improvements in Clinical Laboratory reporting systems; serves as liaison with IT Department as it pertains to Clinical Laboratory.

· Attends and participates in administrative and other meetings, as appropriate and as required by senior management.

· Maintains established hospital and departmental policies, procedures and objectives; maintains the department’s continuous quality improvement, safety, environmental and infection control and compliance with requirements of accreditation and regulatory agencies.

· Ensures each laboratory policy and procedure is reviewed, approved and documented biennially.

· Develops suitable inventory systems; oversees cost control measures for supplies, materiel, equipment and staff.

· Responsible for the preparation of reports, payroll records and other statistical data as required.

· Ensures that testing systems developed and used for each of the tests provide quality laboratory services for all aspects of test performance, including pre-analytic, analytic and post-analytic phases of testing.

· Maintains a safe environment in which employees are protected from physical, chemical and biological hazards.

· Directs the department’s continuing education programs; directs the in-house meetings

· Establishes and monitors criteria for the immediate notification of the practitioner responsible for the patient, when critical limits of specified test results are exceeded; implements corrective actions as required.

· Maintains contact with physicians to solicit appropriate input; addresses problems in a timely manner.

· Maintains effective physician and interdepartmental communications.

· Employs a general supervisor to provide on-site supervision of high complexity tests in accordance with applicable regulations.

· Responsible for the Clinical Laboratory enrollment in an approved proficiency-testing program for all tests performed. This includes:

o Proficiency testing samples are tested as required.

o The test results are returned within specific time limits that the proficiency-testing program dictates.

o Ensuring all Clinical Laboratory staff review the proficiency testing reports

o Responsible for identifying any problems that require corrective action.

o Responsible for implementing an approved corrective action plan when any proficiency testing result is found to be unacceptable.

· Follows Hospital and Department policies and procedures at all times, including but not limited to: Administrative Manual, Environment of Care, Human Resources, Infection Control, Corporate Compliance, Code of Ethics, etc.

· Attend, actively participate and complete in-services, training classes, mandatory classes, seminars/workshops, staff meetings, exercises and drills; reads all department communication and assigned materials.

· Customer Service *–* Provides excellent customer service and shows compassion to all patients, visitors and co-workers. Seeks feedback to ensure all needs are met. Anticipates and recognizes the concerns of others, even if those concerns are not openly expressed.

· Communication ­– Keeps manager and team informed of progress, problems, development and plans. Gets along and interacts positively with co-workers and others.

· Accepts and performs other duties as assigned.
Values/Core Competencies: *
· *Integrity **–*We adhere to a code of values and make commitments that contribute to the welfare of our community.

· *Respect* *– *We seek to create a community within our organization that enhances self-worth of individuals working with us and for our patients. The dignity and respect shown to employees by management and by their fellow staff will be the model for caring for our patients. Management is committed to treating employees fairly, honestly and with respect. In return, management expects a commitment from employees to the values of the organization and its work on behalf of the community.

· *Empowerment* – we are committed to action and expect all employees to be proactive in decision making and problem solving. We delegate authority to match responsibility, expecting decision making to occur as close to the customer as possible.

· *Team Work *– We believe that quality, cost effective, compassionate care can only be provided through team work. The nature of our work and mission require sensitivity to the feelings and points of view of many. We work for the good of the team, are accountable for the results of the team and together share our successes or failures. We maintain an atmosphere of openness, honesty and trust.

· *Accountability **-* We accept personal responsibility for our actions and take ownership of our results. We as individuals recognize achievement and are challenged to improve our performance by providing and accepting coaching and feedback.

· *Quality Improvement *– We will improve value through the process of continuous quality improvement with focus on the relationship between quality and cost. We have a sense of urgency in our search to find better ways of doing everything. We encourage others to try new ideas and measure and recognize results. We are willing to change the status quo to improve.

· *Community collaboration and Benefit *– We will collaborate within the limits or our resources with other agencies and providers to address the health care wellness needs of our community, recognizing that access to services must be made available regardless of an individual’s ability to pay.

· *Prudent use of resources* *– *We will use and maintain our assets and resources prudently in order to meet community expectations. Our organization requires an overall positive return on investment to carry out its mission and to invest in new programs, equipment and facilities. We believe that integration simplifies and improves the process of health care and is a means of achieving economies of scale which will ultimately reduce costs. We seek simplification in the process of patient care and the efficient use of our resources in a changing environment.
Qualifications: *
Required
Bachelor of Science Degree in the Clinical Laboratory Sciences, Biology or Chemistry.
Current CLS licensure in the State of California.
Master's degree in public health, hospital administration or business administration preferred.
Minimum of five (5) years of laboratory training or experiences
· Three (3) years of managerial or progressively responsible supervisory experience in hospital laboratory services management with current working knowledge to meet the requirements for a highly complex laboratory. (Preferred)
Thorough knowledge of relevant Federal, State and local laws; CLIA regulations and other regulatory requirements.
· Knowledge of management of bio-hazardous and hazardous materials and appropriate waste storage

· Strong time management and prioritization skills

· Knowledge of Medical Terminology including medications

· Knowledge of community resources and cultural needs, preferred.
Physical Requirements: *
While performing the duties of this job, staff is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, talk and/or listen. He/she uses his/her hands to do computer work, write reports, do equipment set-up/cleaning/storage, clerical support, etc. He/she will be using the phone frequently. Good vision is needed to be able to read schedules, enter accurate data, etc. He/she must have good general health and demonstrate emotional stability so as to carry out the above-enumerated duties.

· Able to lift up to 50 pounds

· Use proper body mechanics when handling equipment

· Standing, walking and moving 50% of the day

At Intersect ENT, we strive to make localized drug delivery the standard of care in the ear, nose, and throat space. In order to meet that goal, we hire people who like to challenge the status quo, collaborate cross-functionally, and pursue excellence.

Do you embody this spirit of innovation? Are you ready to join our team?

PURPOSE OF JOB:

Responsible for leading regulatory strategy and submissions to ensure post-market compliance with applicable regulations, standards and operating procedures for commercialized PMA products. Responsible for leading strategy for product line extensions including design modifications and indication expansion. Interface with Regulatory Agencies, such as FDA, Notified Body and competent authorities as required. Maintain regulatory correspondence and submissions/registrations. Maintain knowledge in US and international medical device and combination product regulations.

MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provide regulatory leadership to cross-functional product teams, develop regulatory strategies for Class III PMA device-led combination products for product line extensions and post-market activities.
Direct and prepare timely pre and post-market US FDA regulatory submissions (Pre-submissions, PMA supplements, 30-day notices, Annual Reports) and regulatory agency communication/responses.
Lead discussions with regulatory agencies to ensure approval of regulatory submissions.
Ensure compliance to regulatory reporting requirements.
Advise on post-market clinical trial strategies and labeling updates.
Provide regulatory guidance to cross-functional teams including review of design control and quality system deliverables.
Represent RA functional area in the review and approval of Engineering Change Orders (ECO) and develop regulatory impact assessments for post-approval design and manufacturing changes.

EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:

EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS:
Minimum eight (8) years’ experience in regulatory affairs (medical device).
Experience in developing and submitting successful US Class II and Class III submissions.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
OTHER QUALIFICATIONS:
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to work with minimal supervision on multiple concurrent tasks/activities and meet corporate strategies and goals.
Excellent computer skills, knowledge of Microsoft Office package, Windows and e-mail systems.

Enjoy working in a fast-paced startup environment with proven ability to be flexible and adaptable within a changing dynamic environment.
PHYSICAL ACTIVITIES AND REQUIREMENTS, VISUAL ACUITY, AND WORKING CONDITIONS:

Physical Activity - Repetitive motions: Making substantial movements (motions) of the wrists, hands, and/or fingers. Fingering: Picking, pinching, typing or otherwise working, primarily with fingers rather than with whole hand or arm as in handling. Talking: Expressing or exchanging ideas by means of the spoken word.

Physical Requirements - Sedentary work: Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or a negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Jobs are sedentary if walking and standing are required only occasionally and all other sedentary criteria are met.

Visual Acuity - The worker is required to have close visual acuity to perform an activity such as: preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; extensive reading; visual inspection involving small defects, small parts, and/or operation of machines (including inspection); using measurement devices; and/or assembly or fabrication of parts at distances close to the eyes.

Working Conditions - The worker is not substantially exposed to adverse environmental conditions (as in typical office or administrative work).

#XENT

Intersect ENT (NASDAQ: XENT) is a medical technology company dedicated to advancing the treatment of ear, nose, and throat (ENT) conditions through evidence-based innovation. We provide treatments for people with chronic sinusitis, an inflammatory sinus condition that has been shown to substantially reduce quality of life. Sinusitis is one of the most common conditions in the United States.

Marketing Statement
Ride BART to a satisfying career that lets you both: 1) make a difference to Bay Area residents, and 2) enjoy excellent pay, benefits and employment stability. BART is looking for people who like to be challenged, work in a fast paced environment, and have a passion for connecting over 400,000 daily riders to work, school and other places they need to go. BART offers a competitive salary, comprehensive health benefits, paid time off, and the CalPERS retirement program.
Department
The Maintenance and Engineering (M&E) Department at BART has over 1500 employees who serve San Francisco Bay Area communities every day by providing safe and reliable infrastructure to enable on-time service. M&E Engineering leads over one hundred capital design & construction projects along with providing technical expertise for all operational infrastructure assets except rail vehicles. We focus on safety, reliability, and innovation to benefit passengers and employees so trains and projects can move swiftly every day. We hire maintenance-friendly Engineering talent who bring a high level of technical capability, accountability, and enthusiasm for continuous improvement.
Pay and Benefits
BART offers comprehensive compensation and benefits programs. Benefits include CalPERS pension; excellent medical (effective January 1, 2020 current employee cost $150.44 monthly for most plans), vision, and dental coverage; supplemental insurances; paid holidays and vacation; as well as two investment programs, one of which is entirely funded by BART. BART does not participate in Social Security. Complimentary BART passes for employee and qualifying dependents.

Current Assignment
This posting will establish a single incumbent to fill, one (1) current Senior Quality Manager vacancy. The vacancy area is in the Quality Assurance department. Primarily, this position will be tasked with executing a robust Quality Assurance Program for the District, including developing, implementing, and updating the Quality Management System and Quality Management Plans to support the quality of capital, and non-capital project delivery during both design and construction as well maintenance activities in addition to supervising and managing quality assurance staff.

In addition, this position will be accountable for project oversight, implementation, reporting and ongoing operational support of project management practices in support of effective and efficient project execution within the Quality Assurance unit. The incumbent will act as the primary liaison and subject matter expert on Quality Assurance practices and processes. The position will also be responsible for performing project audits, surveillances and assessments, identifying at risk practices, mentoring and coaching individuals in quality management; performs related duties as assigned and coordinates activities with other divisions, outside agencies and the general public; provides highly responsible and complex assistance to the Assistant Chief Maintenance & Engineering Officer;

The successful candidate will demonstrate the following beyond minimum qualifications:

Knowledge of ISO-9001, ISO-55000, Asset Management

Knowledge of continuous improvement principles

Knowledge of Maintenance best practices

Knowledge of Project Quality Practices in Design and Construction

Knowledge of CMMS and RCM

Experience with the implementation and sustainability of a Quality Assurance program that achieved targeted results

Experience with developing and improving quality assurance products

Experience with developing metrics pertaining to Quality Assurance programs

Experience with project reporting and data management

Experience with the formulation of Quality control policies that establish Quality standards

Comprehensive knowledge of project and program management processes and best practices

Demonstrated proven leadership skills and ability

Experience with managing quality staff
Essential Job Functions
Provides professional and complex administrative support to assigned Departmental management staff; develops, plans, organizes, directs and administers, reviews and evaluates complex programs and activities within area of assignment.

Makes recommendations for action and assists in the development and implementation of policies, procedures, metrics, goals and objectives.

Conducts a variety of organizational, operational and analytical studies and investigations; recommends modifications to existing programs, policies and procedures as appropriate; prepares a variety of formal reports.

Directs, coordinates and reviews the quality work of staff and outside contractors; serves as liaison between departments and/or executive offices to ensure consistent quality program implementation.

Directs, coordinates and reviews the planning, development and implementation of contracts and administration of management procedures and internal control mechanisms; ensures the cost effective and efficient use of staff and resources in accomplishing goals and objectives.

Plans, prepares and coordinates the preparation of reports including recommendations to the Board of Directors, committees and other management and executive staff.

Independently composes, compiles and prepares correspondence, reports and documents; reviews finished materials for completeness, accuracy and compliance with District policies and procedures;

Serves as the liaison regarding quality practices within the District and with outside agencies; provides solutions and methodologies for effective quality support to District operations; negotiates and resolves sensitive and controversial issues.

Explains, justifies and defends programs, policies and activities in assigned areas of responsibility

Assumes management responsibility for assigned services and activities of the Quality Assurance Division, responsible for on-going systemwide support of quality assurance activities.

Leads the effort to create a Quality Management System aligned with the requirements of ISO-9001:2015.

Spearheads ISO-9001:2015 Certification and ensures certification is continually evaluated and achieved.

Cultivates a culture of continuous improvement and stays abreast of new trends & innovations in the field of quality management

Manages and participates in the development and implementation of goals, objectives, policies and priorities for quality program; recommends and administers policies and procedures.

Develops, maintains, and posts metrics on quality activities,
Minimum Qualifications
Education: Bachelor’s degree in business or public administration, or a closely related field from an accredited college or university.

Experience: Five (5) years of (full-time equivalent) verifiable quality assurance experience which must have included at least two (2) years of management experience.

Other Requirements: Possession of a valid certification as a Manager of Quality/Organizational Excellence (CMQ/OE) or a Quality Auditor (CQA) issued by the American Society for Quality (ASQ) or similar certification is desirable.

Substitution: Additional experience as outlined above may be substituted for the education on a year-for-year basis. A college degree is preferred.

Knowledge of:
Operational characteristics, services and activities of a comprehensive quality management program.
Operational characteristics, services and activities of a technical documentation control program.

ISO-55000 asset management standards.

Job Title: Indirect Procurement Senior Category Manager - Technology
Job Description:
The Opportunity

The senior leader for IT Sourcing will direct and lead Category Strategy for all IT spend. The accountability requires close collaboration with the CIO and the IT executive team. IT is core to company strategy and achieving the best service, delivery, and cost is key to our success.

This role will focus on developing and implementing Category Strategies for IT’s spend. This Categories include Development, Hosting, Software, Application Managements Support, Temporary Staffing, Consulting, as well is innovative programs in Digital Communications and Marketing. You will partner with key stakeholders to ensure needs are understood and effective procurement strategies are in place. The role will be evaluated based on the successful implementation and execution of spend category strategies, competitiveness of negotiated products and services, and quality of supplier performance as measured by IT and the business Functions.

The position reports to the Head of Indirect Procurement and is based in our San Francisco or San Ramon office.

Responsibilities:
Partner with IT leadership to develop and implement spend category strategies, drive strategy adoption with the business to achieve best-in-class service, delivery, terms, and cost
Leverage a mature understanding for Category Management and contemporary Strategic Sourcing toolsets. Including, but not limited to, Demand Management, Incumbent Sourcing/Negotiation, Request for Information (RFI), Proposal (RFP), and Supplier Relationship Management (SRM)
Develop fact and data drive approach to sourcing while using analytics and marketplace expertise to determine, benefits, risks and change management impact.
Demonstrate contemporary knowledge of IT marketplace suppliers, contracting trends, commercial terms, and KPIs
Align goals to company strategy to then create, direct, and measure progress for your category-specific initiative pipeline
Responsible for establishing category savings targets, monitoring performance, and communicating with business functions
Develop supplier strategies, monitoring supplier performance, and conducting periodic Business Reviews
Lead negotiations of master agreements that result in best in class terms, conditions, and economics.
Partner with Legal to draft comprehensive agreements in alignment with R+F strategy and goals
Support the foundation building of the Indirect Strategic Sourcing Team including taking on special projects, contributing to the tool set, and sharing leading sourcing and procurement practices
Competencies:
Strong interpersonal skills are critical; you need an ability to engage with successfully partner with executive leaders, budget holders, and external suppliers
Excellent communication skills that integrate well with a “.ppt culture”; must have the ability to synthesize data into insights that delivers a “so what” message
An understanding of strategic business objectives and the ability to drive results toward them
The qualified candidate must be self-motivated, poised, have a strong work ethic, and be appropriately self-assured about the value Sourcing brings to the company
A high level of personal integrity when conducting the professional affairs of the organization and dealing with sensitive and confidential data relating to risk and cost
The ability to uphold the goals and culture of the organization
The ability to meet deadlines and work well under pressure
Must be well-organized with a high level of attention to detail
The ability to flex between strategic and tactical problem-solving in a fast-paced work environment
Comfort with ambiguity and confidence to design process and structure to solve business issues
Qualifications:
Demonstrated success leading company-wide strategic sourcing initiatives using a best-practice approach to award business and execute supply agreements.
10+ years of progressing responsibilities in indirect strategic sourcing and category management. Management Consulting a plus.
MBA preferred. Bachelor’s degree required, preferably with a focus on Finance, Information Technology, or Supply Chain Management
Excellent communication, project management, and relationship building skills
Strong understanding of legal terms and of the intricacies of structuring and drafting various agreements
Experience and enthusiasm for establishing processes and tools in a fast-paced environment
Ability to negotiate skillfully and shape winning sourcing relationships.
Highly proficient with both Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel
Effective at developing relationships with cross-functional team members at all levels
Strong conceptual thinking skills with adeptness to lead others through ambiguous and /or complex business problems
The Company

Rodan + Fields was founded in 2000 by Stanford-trained dermatologists Dr. Katie Rodan and Dr. Kathy Fields with a passion for giving people the best skin of their lives — and the confidence that comes with it. With effective products, a unique business model and a powerful community of Independent Consultants, Rodan + Fields has disrupted the skincare category to become a leading skincare brand in North America. The company has grown its innovative line of products and expanded into Canada, Australia and Japan. Headquartered in San Francisco, CA, R+F now employs 500+ people, has more than 300,000 enrolled Independent Consultants and over two million Preferred Customers.

At Rodan + Fields, you will be challenged to make an impact, inspired to do more, and rewarded for your contributions. We are transforming skincare, and we welcome your big ideas to fuel our ambitious growth plans! If you are looking for a life-changing career opportunity, we've got your prescription. You’ll become part of a positive, passionate movement that celebrates greatness and encourages employees to be catalysts for change. We provide a creative, vibrant workplace outfitted with all of the technology, tools and training you'll need to learn, grow and thrive! We create life-changing impact in our communities through our non-profit, Prescription for Change®, the heart of Rodan + Fields. By funding empowerment programs for students, we teach them how to use their skills to make life-changing differences in their lives and the lives of others. Join us and share your talents as we develop innovative solutions for your skin and empower entrepreneurs. In addition to working arm-in-arm with industry leaders, employees at Rodan + Fields enjoy rich benefits plans and perks.

Rodan + Fields is an equal opportunity employer that champions diversity, inclusion and equality for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status.

We welcome employees to be their true, authentic selves, without exception and believe individual differences add value to our team. Join our team; we know it will be a life- changing experience!

Regarding COVID-19
With the spread of COVID-19 globally, our Bay Area offices will remain closed until further notice with the exception of phase 1 employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment.

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and new hire onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing.

At Sisu, we're building a software platform that empowers people to make better decisions using data. Based on years of cutting-edge research at Stanford, Sisu enables users to quickly and comprehensively understand what’s driving their key metrics, so they never miss a window of opportunity to act.

As an Engineering Manager at Sisu, you’ll be instrumental shaping our architecture, product, and company culture. As a rapidly growing Series B company, we’re looking for a leader who has had success scaling teams and shipping enterprise-grade product. You should be intuitive and methodical to solve our most difficult problems.
What you'll accomplish
Manage and build a diverse team of highly technical engineers while fostering an expressive and inclusive environment
Provide career planning, growth, and mentorship
Deliver WOW to our customers by improving the quality of our product and teamwork
Play a pivotal role in scaling our team, product and performance
What you'll need to be successful
Have a product focus and think about the end user
Experience negotiating scope with product managers and designers, and experience coaching engineers on scope negotiation
Compelling and clear communication skills
High degree of emotional intelligence, including the ability to both effectively engage and inspire one’s team members
Experience with backend application services and data management
Nice to have
Fluency with a manual memory-managed language (C++, Rust, etc.)
Understanding of relational query processing and database internals

About iRhythm

iRhythm is a leading digital healthcare company focused on the way cardiac arrhythmias are clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable bio sensing technology with powerful cloud-based data analytics and Artificial Intelligence capabilities. Our goal is to be the leading provider of ambulatory ECG monitoring for patients at risk for arrhythmias. iRhythm's continuous ambulatory monitoring has already put over 2 million patients and their doctors on a shorter path to what they both need – answers.

About this Role

iRhythm is currently seeking an experience, motivated Financial Reporting and Technical Accounting Manager in our San Francisco office. Our work environment is fast-paced, with a collaborative atmosphere. Most of all, we are passionate about delivering innovations that improve the quality of health care and the patient experience. We are looking for like-minded individuals to join our team today!

Responsibilities include:
Manage technical accounting research and ensure that proper accounting treatment is applied accurately applied for all transactions, including unusual and non-recurring transactions
Keep abreast of new accounting pronouncements and evaluate how they affect company. Provide updates to management on new and proposed accounting guidance, and the potential impact on the company
Communicate complex and/or sensitive topics and concepts to a wide audience, including meeting facilitation and presentations
Manage all items pertaining to the external SEC financial reporting process, including drafting of all financial statements, footnotes and MD&A, earnings releases, other regulatory filings, 10-K/Q tie out, and completing GAAP checklists
Manage SEC reporting timeline, coordinate key timelines as well as deliverables and inform parties of necessary deadline adherence for BOD package, press release, and 10-Q/K
Coach and mentor other members of the finance organization on documentation, accounting concepts, and internal controls
Communicate financial results and updates to key stakeholders and executives within the organization.
Review accounting for stock-based compensation in accordance with ASC 718, including valuation, flux analysis, memo documentation, and provide review comments to preparers as necessary
Prepare supporting schedules, documentation, and other information to support the annual audit and quarterly reviews with external auditors
Ensure effectiveness of the internal controls over the financial reporting process and implement process improvements where applicable
Manage Financial Reporting walkthroughs, evaluate and update current processes and policies as a part of ongoing internal controls review. Identify areas for process improvement and present solutions to finance and accounting teams
Participate in special projects and perform additional duties as requested.
About You
Bachelor's degree in Accounting or with an emphasis in Accounting.
At least 5 years of Big4 public accounting experience with at least 1 year at the Manager level is required OR at least 9 years of experience with a mix of industry and Big4 public accounting experience.
Strong understanding and proficiency of U.S. GAAP.
Experience interpreting technical accounting guidance.
Proficiency with MS excel.
Experience working in a SOX compliant environment.
CPA required.
Accounting Knowledge: Applies standard GAAP methods; makes recommendations to improve practices or procedures in compliance with GAAP.
Ability to multitask and deliver to deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
High degree of initiative, exceptional organizational and problem solving skills and commitment to a high level of accuracy.
What is in it for you

This is a full-time position with competitive salary package and excellent benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.

iRhythm also provides additional benefits including 401K (w/ company match), an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, annual organizational/cultural committee events and more!

We welcome and celebrate people of all backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. iRhythm Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D). We are seeking a Study Operations Manager with drug development experience to join the Genentech Safety Assessment Department. The Study Operations group mission is to provide leadership and expertise in nonclinical study management to enable delivery of high quality data to scientific staff, identify opportunities to maximize new and existing partnerships, and influence the industry by driving advances and innovation in animal welfare, science and operational excellence. In our interdisciplinary team environment the successful candidate will effectively perform the duties of a nonclinical study monitor, including but not limited to: study design and protocol development in collaboration with toxicologists, pathologists, and other functional representatives; comprehensive CRO oversight; report and study-related documentation review; contributions to regulatory submissions; and participation on project and non-project teams. Must communicate effectively with colleagues from diverse fields and possess a strong understanding of science, GLP regulations, and the nonclinical CRO landscape. Because we know that employees are critical to our success in bringing novel medicines to patients, we are dedicated to remaining a great place to work and to providing employees with the opportunities and benefits that allow them to bring their best to the business and their personal lives.

The responsibilities for Study Operations Manager (Nonclinical Operations) include:

Serves as the point person for managing GLP and non-GLP outsourced nonclinical toxicology, pharmacokinetic, pharmacology and other study types. Facilitates the planning, conduct, and tracking of studies from design through finalization, including logistics and archival.

Edits and reviews documents for consistency, completeness, and accuracy. Coordinates document review and adjudication with stakeholders.

Supports multiple programs with a good understanding of disease indication, MOA, clinical strategy, and target profile. Serves as the operational lead on Pharmacology Sub Teams.

Demonstrates clear and concise verbal and written communication. Facilitates open communication across all departments. May present at group, department and project team meetings.

Leverages scientific and operational skills. Communicates, manages and resolves study changes and issues with understanding of how and when to escalate.

In partnership with functional representatives, contributes to regulatory submissions. Provides support during regulatory inspections and internal functional group audits.

Ensures GLP compliance and adherence to external and internal SOPs.

Requirements:

Education: Bachelor’s degree in scientific or quality-related field and at least 5 years of experience in toxicology, pharmacology, pharmacokinetics, biological sciences or related discipline. Project Management experience is a plus.

Previous GLP experience in pharmaceutical or biotechnology industry or equivalent GxP transferable experience. Knowledge of ICH and other regulatory guidance is a plus.

Solid understanding of drug development, study design, procedures and documentation practices.

Effective communicator both verbally and in writing.

Must be detail-oriented, with ability to multi-task and work in both an individual and team based environment.

Excellent interpersonal, organizational and problem-solving skills required.

Ability to influence and negotiate effective solutions.

Capable of taking a leadership role when appropriate.

Proficient with MS Office Suite and Adobe Acrobat Pro in PC or Mac. Good understanding of data management systems and other computer systems is a plus.

Desire and willingness to participate in cross-industry consortia and professional society initiatives.

Occasional travel is required as part of job duties.

Are you ready to make a difference in San Francisco? This is an exciting and rare opportunity to join a program with the mission of increasing health care affordability as a step toward universal health care for all San Franciscans.

The Program Manager, SF City Option leads key initiatives and oversees a diverse set of operational functions and projects supporting SF City Option, an employee health care benefits program for individuals who work in San Francisco. The Program Manager oversees internal and external communications and engagement efforts, ensures that SF City Option program goals are completed in a high quality, timely, and efficient manner, and that exemplary service is provided to program participants and SF DPH. The Program Manager must be proactive, highly organized, and able to lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

Develop a communications strategy and spearhead the execution, including new modes of communication and messaging relevant to the audience.
Manage the development of marketing collateral, including website updates, emails, and mailings.

Effectively use data and metrics to inform program and process design.
Coordinate resolution of operational issues with external partners and other SFHP departments.
Lead and manage projects supporting the SF City Option program.
Contribute to SF City Option strategic planning, including project roadmaps and recommendations for annual budget.

WHAT YOU WILL BRING

Bachelor's degree required or equivalent work experience. Master's degree in marketing, communications, public policy, business administration, public administration, or related field preferred.
Three years of project or program management experience on cross-functional projects, including prioritizing tasks and adhering to schedules to meet project deadlines and deliverables.

Proven ability to handle multiple responsibilities and priorities in a fast-paced environment under limited supervision.
Prior experience in evaluating analyses and reports to support program decision-making.
Attention to detail and willingness to assist at all levels in order to ensure on time and accurate deliverables. Proven ability to consistently deliver high quality work products.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills. Effective problem-solver with superior organization and time-management.
Proficiency in MS Office

ABOUT US

The San Francisco Health Plan (SFHP) is an award winning, managed care health plan whose mission is to provide affordable health care coverage to underserved low and moderate-income residents in San Francisco. SFHP also acts as a Third-Party Administrator for SF City Option on behalf of the San Francisco Department of Public Health (SF DPH). SF City Option Program provides a way for employers to comply with the San Francisco Health Care Security Ordinance. Since its launch in 2008, more than 3,700 employers have used SF City Option to make health care benefits available to over 420,000 workers in San Francisco.
