Overview of eero:

Wifi is the foundation of the modern home. Without it, nothing works. eero, an Amazon company, is the first company to deliver a whole home WiFi experience using mesh technology, ensuring there isn't a home layout or connected device we can't handle. Fixing connectivity is, however, just the start. We're working on the building blocks of the smart home by designing our own hardware, enabling it with powerful software, and tying it all together to the cloud. A home that anticipates our needs, takes care of us and our families, keeps us safe and healthy, and saves money and energy.

Overview of the Sales Operations role:

Sales Operations is a critical function at eero, working closely with the Sales, Finance, Manufacturing and Operations teams to ensure seamless go-to-market and beyond. You will be responsible for sales planning, strategy, operations and analytics across our retail and B2B channels. This is a highly strategic and visible role in which you will have a high degree of autonomy and outsized impact. Sales Operations is part of the broader Business Operations team at eero. This role will report to the Head of Business Operations.

What you will drive:

Sales Strategy & Execution:
Define strategy and execution for new market entry (the why and the how)
Implement initiatives to increase conversion and velocity of our pipeline
Sales Analytics:
Streamline sales data and definitions across channels to improve our reporting
Create KPIs and dashboards for various audiences (i.e. sales team, eero/Amazon leadership)
Build and own sales forecasting across channels
Sales Systems:
Evaluate quality and scalability of current sales systems and where appropriate, implement new systems
Maintain our CRM
Sales Process:
Bring rigor and organization to the weekly, monthly and quarterly sales meetings and reports
Create and document our sales processes, and train/onboard team members
Cross-functional projects (examples):
Work on streamlining pricing across channels
Assist the supply chain team to increase inventory visibility for sales team
Basic qualifications:
Bachelor's degree
5+ years of work experience in analytically driven roles at start-ups, consulting, i-banking, and/or PE/VC
Familiarity with sales & marketing tech stack (CRM, marketing automation tools etc.)
Familiarity with BI tools (Looker, Tableau etc.)
Comfort and patience in dealing with ambiguous situations
A beginner's mindset
Preferred qualifications:
Technology/hardware industry exposure

The Manager, Clinical Quality Assurance supports regulatory and quality leadership in the risk-based Clinical Quality Assurance (CQA) oversight of the quality management system development and maintenance in support of clinical trials. Ensuring that all processes contributing to the performance of a clinical trial are established and conducted compliantly and with integrity, troubleshoot escalated clinical trial issues, and manage and maintain databases for the quality system and TMF. This position is ideal for candidates who thrive in a fast-paced, innovative, and dynamic environment while remaining flexible, proactive, resourceful, and efficient to effectively manage multiple projects and responsibilities concurrently. How you’ll contribute: The Manager, Clinical Quality Assurance is an integral member of Freenome’s QA/RA team. You’ll make a significant contribution to our mission of empowering everyone with the tools they need to detect, treat, and ultimately prevent cancer. This role is central to compliance and quality in clinical quality, compliance of clinical trials to industry expectations, operating with integrity, empathy, and ownership. Support clinical team with management of ongoing clinical trials and sample collection Provide QA oversight of clinical CROs, Suppliers, and Testing Vendors Perform QA oversight of clinical operations, both remotely and on-site through review of documents, eTMF, and site audits Perform qualification audits of clinical suppliers Work closely with external suppliers, clinical operations, and internal development teams to ensure project objectives are met in a compliant and timely manner Track Quality documents and records (e.g. deviations, CAPAs, documents, audits, approved vendors) to ensure compliance with internal and external requirements Work with Quality team members and Clinical Operations to develop, implement, and maintain a phase appropriate Quality Management System (QMS) through the creation, review, and approval of documentation including policies and standard operating procedures (SOPs). Review and approve clinical trial protocols and associated documentation (including, but not limited to Patient Information Letters, Informed Consent Documents, Patient Questionnaires, CRFs, etc.), as appropriate, to ensure compliance with relevant standards/regulations Investigate, triage, and document quality issues/deviations, and recommend corrective actions/CAPAs related to clinical issues Assist Quality team members to maintain the internal and external audit programs Participate in regulatory and partner audits Assist in training new staff in quality system requirements and applicable regulations Assist QA with other projects and tasks, where applicable (e.g. support of ongoing development and manufacture of Clinical Trial Material) Summarize Quality activities, trends and areas of potential risk to Leadership and Clinical Team(s) What you’ll bring: BS or equivalent in life science or related field with 5+ years industry experience in Clinical Quality (GCP) with at least 2+ years of Quality Assurance experience; or equivalent education and experience Knowledge of FDA regulations and standards, especially those pertaining to bioanalytical testing and clinical research including global GCP Quality and GCLP, 21 CFR Part 11, 50, 54, 56, 812 using a risk-based approach Excellent written and oral communication, including experience delivering presentations Must be fluent in the English language with strong verbal and written communication skills Strong working knowledge of computer systems validation requirements, regulations, and guidance Sound judgment and commitment to ethical conduct About Freenome Freenome is on a mission to empower everyone with the tools they need to detect, treat, and ultimately prevent cancer. We have pioneered the most comprehensive multiomics platform for early cancer detection through a routine blood draw. By combining deep expertise in molecular biology with advanced computational biology and machine learning techniques to recognize disease-associated patterns among billions of circulating, cell-free biomarkers, we are developing simple and accurate blood tests for early cancer detection and integrating the actionable insights into health systems to operationalize a machine learning feedback loop between care and science. Our recent $270 Million Series C brings our financing to over $500 million from investors, including; Bain Capital, Perceptive Advisors, RA Capital, Polaris Partners, Andreessen Horowitz, funds and accounts advised by T. Rowe Price Associates, Inc., GV (formerly Google Ventures), Roche Venture Fund, Kaiser Permanente Ventures, American Cancer Society’s BrightEdge Ventures, Data Collective Venture Capital, Novartis and Verily Life Sciences. Our Science Freenome is building technology to advance the understanding of cancer through multiple analytes derived from blood. These signals include cell-free DNA, methylation of cell-free DNA, cell-free RNA, circulating proteins, and immune profiling derived from thousands of prospective samples. By developing novel statistical learning methods and applying them to integrate various -omics datasets, Freenome is a leader in modeling specific biological mechanisms to capture disease-dependent signatures, including gene expression, immune response, tumor burden, the tissue of origin, and 3D chromatin structure. By building comprehensive discovery datasets and modeling critical biological systems, Freenome is learning what biological changes are present within the blood between a variety of different disease states, including cancer, autoimmune disorders, infections, drug response, and aging. The synthesis of Freenome’s datasets, cross-functional technical expertise, and audacious mission to discover biological truth, we seek to improve the lives of millions through early detection and early treatment of disease. Our Culture Freenomers are technical, creative, visionary, grounded, empathetic, and passionate. We build teams around divergent expertise, allowing us to solve problems and ascertain opportunities in unique ways. Freenomers are some of the most talented experts in their fields, joining together to advance healthcare, one breakthrough at a time. We value empathy, integrity, and trust in one another, and we respect the diverse perspectives of our colleagues and those we serve. We assume positive intent and give each other the benefit of the doubt with the firm belief that we are a team working toward the same objectives. We believe in empowering and supporting each other in a collaborative and dynamic environment. What does a successful person look like at Freenome? Those who thrive at Freenome prioritize, manage, and execute their own goals with ownership and alignment with those of the company. They embrace our values of empathy, integrity, striving for greatness, servant leadership, trust, and holding themselves and their team accountable to these values. They crave collaboration with brilliant minds from disparate fields of study and believe that hiring and mentorship are fundamental to our success. Above all, they welcome and provide constructive feedback and criticism, trusting in others’ good intentions, and being secure in knowing that embracing mistakes is the best way to learn and grow. For those who pursue challenges, understudied problems, and want the opportunity to see their work impact the lives of millions of people affected by cancer every year, there’s no better place to be than Freenome. Freenome is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. Freenome does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin, veteran status, or any other basis covered by appropriate law.

Our Opening and Your Responsibilities
Quality Engineering Manager is responsible transforming Rainin's quality control and quality engineering departments. This position is responsible for creating a lean and agile QC/QE capability that can react quickly to internal & external customers to meet market demands. The quality engineering manager is responsible for delivering on key targets for safety, quality, delivery, and cost. The position's key responsibilities include the following:
As a Leader, role-modeling company by performing with integrity, high sense of accountability pursue innovation, deliver quality, drive continuous improvement, use resources wisely
Directing the activities of the incoming & in-process quality inspection, quality engineers.
· Supplier quality & Incoming inspection:
Manages operations of incoming inspection and supports supplier management so as to ensure the quality of materials used in production.
Reviews data obtained during all incoming inspection and quality engineering activities to ensure inspection and control effort is focused on the areas of highest risk to product quality.
Recommends whether to accept a product or continue business with a vendor based on performance or history.
Directs technical and administrative workers engaged in incoming inspection and quality control activities.
Identifies opportunities for improving quality processes. Provides concepts, ROI justification and budgets for proposed solutions.
· Quality Engineering:
Leads CAPA - Investigates and drives the resolution of customer complaints regarding production quality.
Responsible for ensuring investigations are properly reviewed, written and closed out with effective root cause analysis identified by utilizing corporate policies and procedures.
Applies quality tools including SPC methods for analyzing data to evaluate the current process and process changes.
Responds to suspect or confirmed non-conforming material, taking corrective action to prevent future recurrence.
Recommends and initiates standards and methods for inspection, testing, and evaluation.
Leads developing equipment qualification IQ/OQ/PQ protocols & reports to ensure robust production processes are delivered to production
Performs quality engineering reviews of design documentation for compliance with stated requirements including vendor quality manuals and company quality records.
Participates in product development teams, focusing on the definition of material specifications that will ensure the consistent quality of materials and products.
Leads QEs and Inspectors in the definition and execution of measurement methods, including CMMs (Zeiss O-Inspect, OGP Smartflash), Optical Comparators (Keyence 6000 series), gauges, pins and other measurement instruments. Leads the team in the review and approval of first article inspection reports.
In-process quality control:
Support 24 X 7 high volume manufacturing of precision equipment & consumables
Ensure compliance to quality standards and Optimizing existing QC processes to automation to increase efficiency and effectiveness
Keeps direct manager abreast of significant issues or developments identified during quality activities and actions being taken to improve the situation.
Proactively identifying deficiencies in current quality processes (upstream and downstream processes)
Collaborating with other leaders to drive end-to-end improvements
Collaborating with R & D on new product development by actively participating in FAI's, materials qualifications, master data enrichment, quality plans and other deliverables
Driving corporate initiatives at the local operations level to meet quality and cost targets
Approving and providing oversight for quality related change documentation
· Supervisory Responsibilities:
Enforces established personnel policies and fosters good employee relations and the professional development of personnel supervised; addressing complaints and resolving problems.
Will be responsible for interviewing, hiring, and training employees; planning, assigning, and directing work; appraising performance, rewarding and disciplining employees.

What You Need to Succeed
· A "Can Do" and resourceful attitude & ability work with diverse team is a must have to succeed in this role.

· BS or MS degree in Quality, Engineering or other applicable major preferred, or equivalent combination of education and work experience.
Minimum 5 to 7 years of QC/QE manager experience (within a plastic molding/assembly/test environment is preferred).
Full management responsibility for managing or supervising QC Tech/Supervisor & Quality Engineers.
· ASQ Certified SQE/SQM preferred.

· Experienced in Minitab; Development software; and proficiency with standard computer applications; MS office applications. Experience with use of statistical tools in quality engineering, including Gauge R&R, Capability Analysis, sampling methods and confidence interval / hypothesis testing.

· Familiarity with manufacturing ERP systems, SAP preferred.

· Has sufficient understanding of measurement methods, equipment and GD&T so as to be able to lead individuals performing those tasks. Actual metrology experience a strong plus.

· Preferred skills/knowledge: Sufficient understanding of Biochemistry to lead individuals performing molecular biology laboratory testing methods, including the concepts of PCR, standard curves, limits of detection and evaluation of OOT results.

Our Offer to You
Medical, dental and vision care coverage and a 401(k) savings plan with company matching – all starting on date of hire
Tuition reimbursement, employee wellness programs, plus other perks and discounts
Parental and caregiver leave policies
All the benefits you would expect from a global leader such as paid time off, flexible spending, short-and long-term disability, basic life insurance, business travel insurance, Employee Assistance Program, and domestic partner benefits
Global market strength and worldwide leadership in weighing
A brand name that is identified worldwide with precision, quality, and innovation
Thousands of patents, design and innovation awards A commitment to extraordinary service on our state-of-the-art equipment

Classification: Exempt Supervisor: General Manager-Manufacturing POSITION OVERVIEW: The Quality Manager is responsible for the leadership of all aspects of Flexsteel’s Dublin Plant Quality Assurance Program. Establishes and maintains effective quality measurements for all appropriate aspects of quality. Promotes and communicates Flexsteel’s quality requirements to associates, customers and suppliers. DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Develops Key Performance Indicators, maintains internal Key Performance Indicator metrics, communicates to Plant and Corporate management, and develops improvement strategies. Drives continuous improvement of warranty performance data, uses the data to determine key opportunities for improvement, and collaborates with other team members to drive improvement. Conducts research on the customer experience for possible product design, material defect or operator execution error and drives solutions based on root cause analysis Monitors, updates, and maintains all quality program documentation and procedures. Communicates effectively with management and all levels within the organization on specifications, standards, and quality related issues. Utilizes analytical thinking in consideration of product and process designs to ensure advanced quality planning tools are utilized in the development process. Oversees the auditing and quality approval of engineering design, samples, supplier components, and manufactured products. Coordinates, investigates, records, and communicates corrective actions for non-conformances to eliminate root causes and prevent recurrence to Plant and Corporate Leadership. Oversees the implementation and administration of the individual, in-process, and plant-wide quality audit programs for the Dublin manufacturing plant. Effectively collaborates with Product Development & Engineering, Manufacturing Operations, Strategic Sourcing, Sales and Customer Care teams to improve and maintain product quality. Plans, organizes and promotes training activities related to quality and reliability. Participates on Continuous Improvement Teams to integrate quality processes into project objectives. Performs other duties as assigned. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED: • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering or Business Administration required • 5 years of prior experience in Quality Assurance leadership for a consumer products manufacturer • Excellent leadership and communication skills (written and verbal). • Experience in implementation of advanced quality planning tools and layered process auditing. • Proficient in using Microsoft Products. Preferred Qualifications: • Experience working in a lean manufacturing environment • Certified Quality Auditor, Certified Quality Engineer designation • Project management experience while working in a cross-functional team • Experience in furniture manufacturing strongly preferred Flexsteel Industries, Inc. offers a competitive salary, along with an excellent full-time benefits package, paid holidays, a friendly, supportive work environment, Flexsteel furniture discounts, and professional growth opportunities.
